loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia, 53 years old, is married and has eight children, three of them in school. Cresencia works very hard to provide for them.

Cresencia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Cresencia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Cresencia has taken a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and to pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. Cresencia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 57 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.  She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Dioscora is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general business.

With your help, Dioscora can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marlita's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Marlita is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Marlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Chaoba Devi

texts.en:
Chaoba, pictured with her father, is an intelligent and good-natured girl. She is 19 years old and supported by her parents. She grew up together with her brother and sister in a happy family. 

“My parents work hard to fulfill my dreams even though we are financially not good,” she said. The financial condition of her family is not reliable, with both parents earning meager income that can hardly manage the household expenses. “Seeing them, I always told myself that I’m going to make them happy someday when I grow up,” she said. Her parents are the main source of inspiration for her to aspire to achieve her dreams. “I had always wanted to dedicate my life for the cause of humanity.” 

There was a bizarre period of time when she was in depression because she was not able to pursue her childhood dream of becoming a doctor. She was obsessed over it. Her academic performance was not good, so she could not make it in the medical selection test conducted by the state. Thousands of candidates compete for a few limited seats in this selection test, and it is very difficult to make it through this test. Her parents were anxious at that time because there was nothing that could be done to console her or send her for coaching classes, due to their weak financial condition. Other students go for private medical coaching for four to five years, especially to appear for this selection test, and yet they cannot make it through.

Considering this, she made up her mind eventually and started going to college. Her parents were happy for her, since she was getting over her depression, but at the same time, she was unhappy because she had to give up her childhood dream. She has a big heart, and is able to console herself that “this is life, and the unexpected is to be faced and accepted by us.” When life closes one door, the other opens. 

Likewise, she feels relieved and thrilled that she was selected for cabin crew this time. She considers this opportunity as a second chance given by God to do something more in life and dedicate her life for the cause of humanity. She wants to serve people while flying high. 

However, the thought of paying a large sum for a security deposit, which is mandatory for selected candidates to undergo training, still disturbs her mind, and she feels helpless. She heard of Kiva education loans from her friends. This delighted her mind that her dreams are going to be finally fulfilled. The Kiva loan she obtained has unburdened her parents’ financial instability, as well as hers. She will pay the refundable deposit with the Kiva loan and start to join the training. 

She says the financial help given to her is priceless, and she is very much grateful to the lenders for their generosity. She ensures that she will extend help to her parents once she starts earning and also provide for her siblings with good education for achieving their goals. 

She said, “Thank you Kiva and WSDS for the change you brought in my life.”

loans.use: to pay the security deposit for cabin crew training.

loans.name: Armando Rogelio

texts.en: Armando lives with his family in San Martin, Puebla. He works in the country side with cattle. Armando and his wife work hard to give their children the best life and opportunities they can. They have invested all their saving in their house where they have been living for the last 15 years. They never had the money to install a proper roof and the walls were not built correctly so now they are starting to fall. Armando has an informal job and makes around $800 USD a month. This makes it impossible to get a credit from other institutions. Armando knows that he needs to install a proper roof and repair the walls as soon as possible before more damage is done. This is why he is asking for a credit, to get the money he needs to buy all the materials and do all the work at once. Armando will receive training and supervision from Ecoblock to make sure that this time he does the work correctly. His son will help him in the task. Armando wants to build and have a house he can feel proud of.

loans.use: to install a proper roof and properly build walls

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She restarted her business in 2012 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Nida will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 23 years old with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Jenalyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jenalyn has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Jenalyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta lives with her four children and husband in Puebla. Vicenta works sewing clothes at home, basically attaching badges to uniforms. Vicenta works hard to be able to give her kids a better life and more opportunities. Part of a better life for her is a proper home. She and her husband worked hard to build a home, however she knows that the dirt floor in the home is a health hazard and being able to change that will considerably improve their life. Since Vicenta has an informal job and makes around $ 700 USD a month, access to credit with other institutions is very difficult. Vicenta is asking for a credit so she can finish buying the materials needed to install a proper ceramic floor and get rid of the dirt. Her husband will do the construction work and the family will receive visits from a certified technician that will make sure the work was done properly. Vicenta is excited to finally have a home she can feel proud of.

loans.use: to buy materials to install ceramic floor

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia lives in San Martin, Puebla with her husband and children. Alicia has worked as a seamstress the last 20 years. She has worked very hard to start building what she calls her dream home. Her husband recently bought a piece of land where they can start building it. Alicia and her husband want to do this right and recognizes that she needs a little technical orientation and has assisted to some of the workshops Ecoblock gives. She has finally saved some money to start building and hopefully soon move out of her in-laws house where she has lived since she got married. Alicia has an informal job and makes around $800 USD a month. Given this, she is not able to go to traditional banks for a credit. Alicia is asking for a credit to buy the construction materials needed to start building. She and her husband will be trained and supervised by technicians and architects from Ecoblock. Alicia wants to make sure that the first step she takes is one that will last forever.

loans.use: to buy materials to build the first room of her new house

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 48 years old, married, and has four children.  She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Belinda is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Belinda has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her business. With your help, Belinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising cows in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and feed for her cow raising business.

Sitti Hawa has been in this business for 25 years. Sitti Hawa earns more income from fruit vending, farming coconuts and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sitti Hawa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Hazel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Hazel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.en: Rosalba lives in San Martin, Puebla with her three children and her husband. Rosalba every days wakes up very early to milk her cows and take whatever she gets from the convenience store nearby. She also works ironing clothes for the people in town that do not have time or skills to do so. Rosalba says that hard workers run in her family. Rosalba and her husband are very happy with the house they have today since it is the result of years of effort and work. Today their home has cement floor in the bathroom and bedrooms but a dirt floor in the kitchen. Rosalba has an informal job and makes around $1,200 USD a month. This makes it nearly impossible for her to have a credit from another institution. Rosalba is asking for this credit to buy the ceramic floor for her house and other materials needed to install it. Rosalba and her husband will do all the work and receive supervision visits from certified technicians to make sure that the work they do meets all the quality and safety standards. Rosalba is looking forward to have a floor she can sweep and clean!

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor to replace the dirt floor in her house

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 39 years old and works hard to support her family. She has a butcher business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Christina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  buy additional pork, beef, and dressed chicken to sell through her butcher business.

Christina successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Christina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her butcher business.

loans.name: Bisail

texts.es:
Bisail de 50 años de edad, solo estudió hasta séptimo grado de educación básica, está soltero pero tiene 3 hijos que aún estudian y dependen de él.

Bisail tiene un pickup en el que sale a recoger latas, láminas, aluminio, etc para reciclaje y además realiza trabajos agrícolas.

Él solicita este crédito para pagar una deuda que adquirió para sembrar granos básicos.

A futuro él sueña con comprar un carro mejor para hacer siempre su trabajo y darles buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bisail is 50 years old and has a seventh grade education. He is single but has three children who still go to school and depend on him.

Bisail has a pick-up truck in which he goes out to collect cans, sheet metal, aluminum, etc. for recycling.

He dreams of someday buying a better vehicle so that he can always do his work and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: To pay off a debt he incurred in order to plant basic staple crops.

loans.name: Almash

texts.ru: Алмаш 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Алмаш среднее образование, она работает няней в доме-интернате, получает ежемесячную заработную плату в размере 7,500 сом (KGS). С 1995 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 20 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,20 Га, где Алмаш выращивает фасоль. Алмаш на ежедневной основе реализует молоко, ее ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмаш обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 бычков с целью разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алмаш планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она накопить средства на образование ее младшей дочери-школьницы.
texts.en: Almash is 50, married, and the mother of three children. She has a high school education and works as a nanny at a boarding house, earning 7,500 som (KGS) per month. She has been farming in order to earn supplementary income since 1995. She currently has two cows, two horses, 20 sheep, and a 1.20 hectare plot of land where she grows beans. She sells milk every day, earning 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her farm, Almash applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to purchase five young bulls for breeding and increasing her livestock numbers. She plans to use the profits from the loan to continue developing her farm and to pay for her youngest school-age daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase five young bulls in order to invest in her business and pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is a single mother of two children that lives in San Martin in Puebla Mexico. She has built a great reputation at her job as someone who is realible and well organized. Jenny has one daughter and one son. They live in a two bedroom house, and she shares the room with her daughter. Her daughter is now a teenager and Jenny know that they both need their own space. Jenny earns around USD 1,000 a month. The house where she lives is the result of years of work and savings. Since Jenny has a low income, she does not have access to any credit for her home. Jenny has been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom for her daughter. She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. Jenny and her son will work on the construction and will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to make sure the new room meets all the quality and safety standards. The new room will give Jenny and her daughter their own space. Jenny is a hard working mother that wants to give a better and more comfortable life to her kids.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new room for her house

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Joylyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell fish. Joylyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Joylyn successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients, like meat, canned goods, eggs, and vegetables.

Lourdes has been in this business for 17 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, like meat, canned goods, eggs, and vegetables.

loans.name: Firoja

texts.en:
Firoja is a 22-year-old woman who is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is blessed with one son and lives in the Jalpaiguri District of West Bengal. Despite bad circumstances, Firoja puts forth great effort in cooperation with her husband, 25-year-old Khursid, to be able to satisfy the family’s demands. Their son is a student of grade one. 

She, along with her husband, has been successfully operating a grocery shop for the last few years. She sells biscuits, rice, flour, soap, cooking oil, salt, and sugar to her community. This store is the only source of income for the family, but this is not enough to pay their only son's school fees and the family's other expenses. She wants to enhance their business by adding more stock of what they sell.  

She hopes that adding different varieties of products will improve their earnings and the family's status. Firoja is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, BJS, to purchase more grocery items to increase her business sales as well as her income. Firoja is an optimistic person, always aiming for the best and plans to receive more loans with the coming days to keep improving her family’s standards of living.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for their grocery store.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old, married, and has one child in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivic has been pig-fattening for seven years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dimna

texts.en:
Dimna is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

Dimna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Dimna has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Dimna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer que genera ingresos para lograr sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por ella y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 17 a 23 años. Por iniciativa propia empezó haciendo manicure a sus familiares y fue poco a poco extendiéndose a vecinos y a amigos hasta que finalmente se dedicó a esta actividad, en la cual hoy se encuentra ofreciendo servicios de corte de cabello, alicer, manicure, pedicure, tratamientos de cabello etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado trabajando desde muy temprano y hasta que su cliente lo requiere, durante todos los dias. Sus principales compradores, son sus vecinos, referidos y familiares, que encuentran en el punto de servicios de belleza de Claudia, la mejor opción para sentirse bellos, con el manejo de la imagen que esta hace a su clientela.  Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su local y tener su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará esmaltes, tintes, shampu , cremas y masajes en un mayor volumen,  con ello planea mejorar aun mas la calidad del servicio y dará mayor capacidad competitiva a su negocio en el mercado, lo que significa un gran beneficio para ella y su familia, en tanto que generará mayores utilidades que van dirigida directamente al desempeño efectivo de su hogar.
texts.en:
Claudia makes an income to support her family, which consists of her and her four children who are between 17 and 23 years old. She started her own business giving manicures to family members, and slowly spread her customer base to neighbors and friends. She finally expanded her business, so that it now offers hair cuts, hair straightening, manicures, pedicures, hair treatments, etc. She conducts her sales in cash, and works from early in the morning until she finishes with her clients, every day. Her main customers are her neighbors, referrals, and relatives, who believe that Claudia’s service is the best option to feel beautiful, as she manages their images. 

Claudia’s goal is to expand her store and to own her own home. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first loan through the Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy nail polish, dyes, shampoo, creams, and massagers, in a larger volume. With the purchases she plans to further improve the quality of service and be more competitive in the market. This will be a great benefit to her and her family, as the higher profits she will generate will directly impact her home.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, dyes, shampoo, creams, and massagers, in higher volume.

loans.name: Joyda

texts.en:
Dairy farming is something that is more of a passion for Joyda than a business. She started pursuing her passion few years ago. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Tekatuli, a remote village in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She is a proud mother of two school-going sons, who are in grade 9 and grade 12. Her husband Giren is a small farmer.  His income is quite unsatisfactory.

For the past few years, she has been making a small living through practicing dairy farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk to the nearby market. She passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business.  

BJS (Kiva's partner), is an organization that supports enterprising women in doing business to financially help their families. So Joyda is seeking a loan from BJS to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing more milk per day. That means she will be able to reach to more customers and add more income to the family fund. From this loan, the life of Joyda will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for dairy business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cirila is 32 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Cirila has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business, like bamboo, wood, and nails.

Cirila has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like bamboo, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 52 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Alona is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Alona has been pig-fattening for one year now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alona would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (in photo) is 27 years old. She has been married since 2007 and has one son and two daughters. Two of her children attend school and another one is still young. She works, farming, for hire by her villagers for which she gets paid a fee. Her husband is a driver for a company. 

Sokha hopes to build a new house to live in. Because she did not have her own land or property, she had asked a landlord who is her neighbor to build a house for a temporary stay. Now she has her own land property which she would love to rebuild a house on. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to build a new house.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Celsa has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Celsa requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Celsa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vitamins and vaccines for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and has four children.  Josephine is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. 

Josephine requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new variety of rice seeds.

Josephine has been farming rice for 25 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of rice seeds

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Levy has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Levy would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and has a live-in partner. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, and cereal.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, and cereal. 

Marilyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, and cereal.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and married, with five children. She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizer, and other supplies for her business.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years and she also earns additional income from coconut wine-vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings, fertilizer, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 44 years old, married, and has five children, four currently in school.

Juanita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Juanita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Lorna has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 52 years old and has a live-in partner with three children.

Paterna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, detergent soap, noodles, and bath soap to sell.

Paterna has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income from fish vending and coconut wine vending.

Paterna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, detergent soap, noodles, and bath soap to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married and works hard to support her family by selling ornamental plants in the Philippines.

Nancy requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her business.

Nancy has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is a 39-year-old farmer that with the help of his father and his wife, produces and sells cheese in Villaflores, Chiapas. While Hector takes care of the cows along with his father, Rosa Elena, his wife, makes the cheese and Hector sells it locally. 

Hector is deeply concerned with the preservation of the natural resources of his community. With hard work along the years, he has been able to transform his farm and implement a silvopastoral system. His dream is to one day reduce the space he uses for his cows from 8 HA to 2 HA and leave the remaining 6 HA exclusively for forest conservation. 

A loan of 13,000 MXP will help Hector buy a forage harvester that will allow him to make silage for the dry season and increase his milk production. A fraction of the loan will also be used to buy equipment to make cheese to reduce the time Rosa Elena spends making cheese. 

With this loan, Hector and Rosa Elena will improve their living conditions, while contributing to the conservation of an area of high environmental value and thus setting the example for other families that sustainable practices can also be profitable.

loans.use: to buy a forage harvester and equipment to make cheese

loans.name: Yirama

texts.es: Yirama de 33 años de edad se dedica a prestar servicios como manicurista y de tratamientos capilares y corte de cabello, dese hace 12 años, cuando en el año 2012 decidió emprender su negocio, después de aprender de su tía todo lo relacionado con la belleza y tratamientos de cabello. Yimara desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche, trabaja haciendo cortes, tintura desrizado de cabello, manicure, pedicure etc. a sus vecinas y referídos por estas, quienes son sus principales clientes. Su meta más adelante, es tener su local de su propiedad y también una vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío sea el ahorrar, aumentando sus ingresos para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará shampu, tintes, cremas, masajes etc. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, porque obtendría una disminución de sus costos, por compras en volumen, mejoraría la calidad de su servicio y así mismo impactaría en su ventas, que son su objetivo principal, para alcanzar sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Yirama is 33 years old, and has worked for 12 years providing manicure, hair treatments, and hair cut services. In 2012 she decided to start her own business, after learning from her aunt everything related to beauty and hair treatments. Yimara works from 2 pm until 8 pm, cutting, dying, and straightening hair, giving manicures and pedicures, etc. to her neighbors and their referrals, who are her main customers. 

Her future goal is to have her own salon, and her own home. Her greatest challenge is saving, and being able to increase her income to do so. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy shampoo, dyes, creams, massagers, etc. This investment will improve her business, as her costs will be reduced from purchasing in bulk. Her service will improve, which will impact her sales, which will allow her to achieve her main objective of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, dyes, creams, massagers, etc.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Necitas works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from nipa roof-making. Necitas is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more materials for her fishing business.

Necitas has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 head of cattle to develop a sustainable farming ecosystem.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 38 year old, married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

Lorena has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a house rental.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emely is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Emely has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Emely has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 60 years old and married, with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Merlinda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, vinegar, canned goods, candies, biscuits, and soft drinks. 

Merlinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and married, with three children. Angelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Angelina has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits.

Angelina aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a 36 year old, married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ellen has a business selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Ellen requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy flower pots, fertilizers and other supplies for her business. Ellen has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy flower pots, fertilizers and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 34 years old and married with three children.

Marcia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marcia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marcia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania is 22 years old and lives with her boyfriend as an unmarried couple in an apartment. In addition to her job in sales in a small printing shop, she has been working in manicures with clients in her home. She dreams with  be financially stable and to expand her business into a formal setting. 

She aims to continue expanding her customer base and increase her sales but she does not have enough capital to do so. For this reason, Estefania would like a loan of MXN5,000 to take her business into a formal establishment and begin her nail salon.

This is Estefania's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to open a nail salon based on her experience working with clients in her home.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 38 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Antonieta has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and running a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business, selling multi-vitamins and medicine in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers through her business, selling multi-vitamins and medicine.

Carmelita has been in this business for 16 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling school supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a business raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years now.

Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old, married, and has seven children, one who is still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is 31 years old, is unmarried, and lives with her family. In addition to her job as a waitress at a restaurant, she has generated income for her family for the past 6 years making promotional items such as t-shirts, mugs, calendars, and other items. She dreams of being financially stable to expand her business into a formal setting to uplift the living status of her family. 

She aims to continue and improve her business and increase her sales but lacks the technology to make better designs that would allow her to give a better service. For this reason, Gabriela would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase a new computer and software.

This is Gabriela's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy a computer in order to make better designs for promotional items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a sewing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like thread, fabric, etc. for her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like thread, fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for the family.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like sanitary pads, coffee, seasonings, cereals, shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell.  Elisa has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items, such as sanitary pads, coffee, seasonings, cereals, shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. 

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like sanitary pads, coffee, seasonings, cereals, shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 30 years old, is married and has two children who are in school.

Emelie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Emelie requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.  Emelie has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of ocote burning, eliminating indoor pollution and improving families economy

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 37 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Emily has a business buying and selling native mats  in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of native mats to sell.  Emily has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of native mats to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 72 años de edad, no estudio, esta acompañado. Su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos. Tiene 5 hijos pero no viven en casa, ya estan acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares. Carlos trabaja con ganado bovino y en la agricultura, lo ha hecho por mas de 50 años y lo aprendio de sus padres y decidio hacerlo para obtener un ingreso economico extra para poder sostener a su familia y poderles dar estudio a sus nietos.

 La distancia esta como a 1 km de su casa y viaja a pie o en carreta, para llegar a sus cultivos. Le apoya su compañera de vida y un nieto el mayor a realizar el trabajo. Su horario de trabajo no se puede medir. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ganado de repasto (bovino). El préstamo le mejorara mucho porque tiene la oportunidad de tener mas ganado y por lo tanto le mejorara sus ingresos economicos y asi tener mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños, son a pesar de su edad trabajar lo mejor que pueda para tener una buena vejez.
texts.en:
Carlos is 72 years old, did not attend school, and is in a relationship.  His partner works at home.  He has 5 children, but they do not live at home. They are already in relationships, and they have their own homes.  Two of his grandchildren live with him, but they do not depend on him. 

Carlos works with cattle and in agriculture, which he has done for more than 50 years and which he learned from his parents.  He decided to do this in order to bring in extra income to be able to support his family and to send his grandchildren to school.

The distance to his crops is about 1 km from his house and he travels either on foot or by cart.  His partner helps him in life, and one grandchild helps him to do the job.  His work schedule cannot be measured.

The loan he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy more cattle.  This loan will help him a lot because he will have the opportunity to get more livestock, and will therefore increase his income and have a better quality of life.

His dreams are, in spite of his age, to work as best he can so he is able to have a good life in his old age.  For his grandchildren, he hopes that they study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for his livestock business.

loans.name: Ilda Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Ilda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive con su esposo e hijos en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, al occidente de Honduras tiene una pulpería desde hace 3 años la cual ha sabido administrar muy bien y debido a su buen servicio y la variedad de productos que vende ha logrado obtener buena clientela.

Doña Ilda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser pollo, chuleta, refrescos, embutidos, arroz, azúcar, café, agua,  etc. y poder surtir su pulpería y esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias.

Ilda espera que con este préstamo pueda mejorar sus ingresos ya que su pulpería estaría más surtida y así mejoraría un poco su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, es una persona muy responsable, honesta  y sobre todo muy trabajadora, uno de sus sueños es de tener una uno de los negocias más grandes y reconocido de la zona.



Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Septiembre-2014
texts.en:
Ilda is a very hard-working and responsible person. She lives with her husband in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, in western Honduras, and has had a small general store for three years that she has learned to run very well. Due to her good service and the variety of products she sells, she has managed to acquire a good clientele.

Ilda is requesting the loan to purchase products such as  chicken, pork chops, soft drinks, cold cuts, rice, sugar, coffee, water, etc. This is so that she can stock her store and this way offer better service to her customers and earn better profits.

Ilda hopes that through this loan she can improve her income, as her store will be better stocked. In this way she would improve quality of life a bit for her and her children. She is a very responsible honest, and above all, a very hard-working person. One of her dreams is to have one of the largest and best- known stores in the area.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – September 2014

loans.use: To buy chicken, pork chops, soft drinks, cold cuts, rice, sugar,  coffee, water, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Francisca Etelvina

texts.es:
Francisca de 31 años de edad, es licenciada en computación. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como agente policial. Con él ha procreado un hijo que estudia kínder. 

Francisca por el momento no está ejerciendo su profesión,  porque no ha encontrado un trabajo fijo. Sus ingresos dependen de remesas que le envían sus familiares y de la ayuda de su esposo.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maya ciclón, tubos galvanizados, electrodos, cemento, arena y  pagara la mano de obra, para construir una cerca alrededor de su vivienda. El crédito ayudara ya que ella al tener la cerca tendrá la confianza de salir sin estar pensando lo que pueda pasar, también tendrá encerrados sus animales y su hijo estará más seguro.


El sueño de Francisca es un  día poder ejercer su profesión  y cuando tenga un capital  establecer su negocio y poder ayudar así a otros dándoles empleo, para que  cada una de las familias vaya en pro del desarrollo.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 31, has her degree in computing.  Her husband works as a policeman.  With him, she has a son who is in Kindergarten.

For the moment, Francisca isn’t practicing her profession because she hasn’t found a steady job.   Her income depends on her husband’s help and the remittances that her family members send her.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of cyclone fencing, galvanized metal pipes, electrodes, cement, and sand, and to pay for labor in order to build a fence around her house.  The loan will help because she will be able to go out without thinking of what might happen.  She will also have her animals fenced in, and her son will be safer.

Francisca’s dream is to be able to practice her profession some day, and when she has some capital, to establish her own business.  She can then help others, giving them jobs, so that each of her family members can go on, promoting development.

loans.use: to buy cyclone fencing, galvanized metal pipes, electrodes, cement, and sand, and to pay for labor to build a fence around her home.

loans.name: Ever Omar

texts.es:
Ever de 24 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, solo tiene un hijo quien depende de él. 

Ever es soldado desde hace 4 años, también en sus tiempos libres trabaja en remodelación de casas y en la agricultura. 

Él necesita el préstamo para hacer mejoras en su vivienda. 

Sus sueños son tener una buena casa y darle buena educación a sus hijo.
texts.en:
Ever, 24, was able to study up until the ninth grade. He is in a relationship and his partner is dedicated to the household duties. He has one son who depends on him.

Ever has been a soldier for four years. In his free time, he works in agriculture and remodeling houses.

He needs this loan to make improvements to his home. His dreams are to have a good house and to give his son a good education.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se gana la vida con su pequeña tienda de productos varios la cual decidió colocar desde hace 10 años en su vivienda, por lo que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que visitan su negocio y consumen sus productos, y es gracias a este negocio que logra sostener la economía de su hogar el cual comparte con su esposo y hijo de 12 años de edad, en el cual su esposo también aporta para los gastos económicos. María sabe que su negocio es la mayor fuente de ingresos de su hogar y es por ello que desea invertir para tener más productos que ofrecer a su clientela, María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, arroz, frijol, leche, huevos, pan dulce, café, etc.
texts.en:
María, 36, is an admirable woman who makes a living with her small store. She decided to set up her store ten years ago in her home. She has a good number of clients who visit her business and buy her products. Thanks to this business, she manages to sustain her household, which she shares with her husband and 12-year-old son. Her husband also contributes to their financial expenses. 

María knows that her business is her household's greatest source of income, which is why she wants to invest in more products to offer to her clients. María has applied for a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, rice, beans, milk, eggs, sweet bread, coffee, etc.

loans.use: to invest in corn, rice, beans, milk, eggs, sweet bread, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 20 años de edad es un joven trabajador que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 4 años junto a su grupo familiar. Él se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de productos plásticos como: guacales, termos, vasos, tazas, basureros, etc. Tomando en cuenta que esta pequeña venta en su única fuente de ingresos y es gracias a ella que sostiene la economía de su hogar, Carlos ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y es por ello que solicita un credito a FUSAI para invertir en: vasos, platos, basureros, guacales, cantaros, etc. `Para mejorar su negocio de venta de plásticos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 20, is a young worker who has lived in his own home for four years along with his family. He makes a living selling a variety of plastic products, such as crates, thermos bottles, glasses, mugs, garbage cans, etc. 

Taking into account that this small business is his only source of income to sustain his household, Carlos made the decision to invest in his business to improve his sales and offer a larger quantity of products to his clients. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from FUSAI to invest in glasses, plates, garbage cans, crates, pitchers, etc. to improve his business selling plastic products.

loans.use: to invest in glasses, plates, garbage cans, crates, pitchers, etc.

loans.name: Rina Consuelo

texts.es: Rina de 53 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su hogar apoyada en su negocio de venta de artesanías en el mercado central y en su vivienda. Rina sabe que su negocio en su mayor fuente de ingresos y es por ello que desea invertir en él para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: artesanías para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rina  is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She is an admirable woman who does her best each day to provide better living conditions for her household.  She is helped in this by her business selling crafts in the central market and in her home.

Rina knows that her business is her greatest source of income and this is why she wishes to invest in it,  so that she can offer better variety to her customers.

Therefore she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in crafts for stocking her business.

loans.use: To purchase crafts for supplying her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
In the year 2009, Estrella learned of Paglaum MPC, and the financial assistance it extends.  As a farmer in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan for her farming activities. 

She has taken several loans and maintains a good repayment record.  To this day, Estrella feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Estrella wishes to sustain her business, and to be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 29 лет, разведена, есть сын - школьник. У Гулзады высшее образование, она работает в школе учителем младших классов. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1998 года занимается животноводством, полеводством и продажей молока. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзады в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец и 0,50 Га земельной доли, на которой она выращивает клевер. В общей сложности деятельность Гулзады приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Гулзада является одним из трех членов группы "Майрам". Доходы от кредита Гулзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также накопить средства на приобретение земельного участка для постройки собственного дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulzada is 29, divorced, and has a son in grade school.  She is one of three members of the group "Mayram".  Gulzada has a university education and works as a schoolteacher for some of the earlier grades.  She also raises livestock, grows crops and sells milk to earn some extra money on the side, and has done so since 1998.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has two cows, ten sheep, and 0.50 hectares of land for growing clover, while her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som.  To further develop her farm, she is seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy some calves.  She plans on using any additional money she earns due to the loan to further expand her farm, and will also set some of it aside to buy a plot of land for a family house.

loans.use: buy more calves for her farm

loans.name: Tara Jangela

texts.en:
Tara Jangela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Tara Jangela earns more income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional milk, sugar, rice, etc., for her food-vending business. Tara Jangela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional milk, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Vitty

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vitty works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Vitty is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline and other fishing materials

Vitty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline and other fishing materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lolita has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like, thread, needles, fabric, etc.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, needles, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam was born in 1982. She is living with her family in Salt, Jordan.

Ibtisam has been selling baby blankets for one year. This business was profitable to her and became a good source of income. She is planning to expand her business until she opens her own shop in the future.

Now she needs to raise her profits and to expand her business by adding variety to her products such as stationary and tools, so she is requesting a loan to purchase them.

loans.use: to purchase stationary items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in more embroidery tools for her business.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrike has been doing agriculture and livestock to earn a living for the past almost 24 years. Currently she has one cow, as well as pigs and chickens, and sells eggs, dairy, baby animals and little chickens to locals. She also plants and sells large quantities of feed for livestock such as fodder, clover, corn and wheat. In addition to all of this, she also has grapevines and fig and plum trees. 

Mrike is a mother of five who lives in the rural northern part of Albania.

She wants to invest in a dairy cow and she is seeking your financial help. A loan in an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek will help her achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yessica Marvin

texts.es: Yessica de 28 años de edad habita al lado de su esposo y su hija de 4 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 5 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días se esfuerza por sostener la economía familiar por medio de su negocio de venta de bisutería como: aritos, pulseras, collares, anillos, etc. los cuales ella misma elabora para posteriormente venderlos. Yessica siempre está  buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos los cuales le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, y es por ello que desea invertir en su negocio, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hilo, ganchos, piedras, cristales, etc. Para seguir elaborando sus productos.
texts.en:
Yessica, 28, has lived with her husband and her 4-year-old daughter in her own home for five years. She is a hardworking woman who makes an effort every day to sustain her home economy through her jewelry business. She sells items such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc. She makes the jewelry herself and later sells the products. 

Yessica is always looking for ways to earn a better income, which allows her to give her family better living conditions. Therefore, she would like to invest in her business. She has applied for a loan from FUSAI to invest in thread, hooks, stones, crystals, etc. to continue making her products.

loans.use: to invest in thread, hooks, stones, crystals, etc.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, es albañil y agricultor; pero el que mas desarrolla es la agricultura. Su nivel de estudio fue hasta el sexto grado, no continuo sus estudios porque le gusto mejor trabajar para ayudar en los gastos del hogar, esta casado y junto con su esposa tiene 5 hijos de 23, 18, 17, 13 y 10 años de edad de los cuales 4 estudian mientras que el otro se dedica a trabajar para apoyar a su familia.
 
Su esposa se dedica al comercio de verduras y frutas tales como cebolla, chile, tomate, pepino, lechuga, uvas, manzanas, guineos etc., mientras que José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 17 años trabajo que lo aprendió de sus amigos quienes se dedicaban a este oficio. Para llegar a su trabajo José viaja en bicicleta 1 kilometro trabajando en el horario de 5:00 am a 12:00 del mediodía.

El crédito que esta solicitando, es para la compra de una vaca lechera donde podrá obtener un ingreso más para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de él es que sus hijos sean profesionales, para que tengan un buen futuro y mejores posibilidades de trabajo, tener 5 animales y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, is a bricklayer and farmer, but he spends more time as a farmer. He studied until the sixth grade.  He did not continue his studies because he preferred to work  in order to help with the expenses in his home.  He is married and together with his wife he has 5 children, ages 23, 18, 17, 13 and 10.  Four of his children are in school while his other child is working to support their family. 
 
His wife works selling vegetables and fruits such as onions, chilli peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, grapes, apples, bananas, etc.  José has worked in agriculture for more than 17 years, work he learned from his friends who already worked in the field.  To arrive at his job José travels 1 kilometer on a bicycle.  He works from 5:00 AM until 12:00 noon.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a milking cow, so he will be able to obtain a greater income to give his family a better quality of life.

He dreams of his children to become professionals, so that they can have a good future and better possibilities for work.  He also dreams of having 5 animals and to be able to improve his home.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: A sus 30 años de edad Maria es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 6 y 10 años de edad, de los cuales los 2 menores asisten a la escuela,  Maria se dedica hace 6 meses a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, dice que ofrece puerta  a puerta y  a sus amigas, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en una empresa donde  no le pagaban bien y sobre todo tenía que estar fuera de casa y no tenia quien le atienda a sus hijos, es por este motivo que decidió emprender su negocio de venta de calzado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en zapatos de damas, caballeros  y niños, la aspiración de Maria es mejorar sus ventas para incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos que son muy necesarios para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 30-year-old single mother. She has three children, ages 1, 6, and 10. The two young children are going to school. Maria has been selling shoes from a catalog for 6 months. She offers her products door-to-door and to her friends. Before, she was working in a company which did not pay her well. She always had to be out of the house and she did not have anyone to take care of her children. Therefore, she decided to start her own business selling footwear. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of women's, men's, and children's shoes. Maria's goal is to improve her sales to expand her business and improve her income, which is necessary for her children's education and food.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 21 year old university student majoring in Psychological Guidance, and he is in his last year. He lives with his seven family members in Ajloun-Jordan. 

Rashed is planning to find a job in his study field after getting his Bachelors’ so that he will be independent and he is only one step closer to that. Now he is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees because he doesn’t have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq is an 18-year-old university student majoring in the Hebrew language, and he is in his first year. He lives with his family in Ajloun, Jordan. Tareq is planning to find a job in his study field after getting his Bachelor's so that he will depend on himself. Now he is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees because he doesn’t have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Zoje

texts.en: Zoje bought the dairy cow with your financial help and now she needs your help again to invest in a tractor. She has saved some money from the raw milk she sold from the new dairy cow she bought from the previous loan and she is extremely grateful to all lenders. Zoje wants to use the tractor on her own land and also to offer service to other villagers.

loans.use: to invest in an agricultural tractor.

loans.name: Oscar Alfredo

texts.es: Oscar de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una joven de 23 años, un varón de 17 años de edad y además vive con ellos su nieto de 11 meses de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida  como motorista una empresa cercana, y además posee un negocio de venta de productos varios y comida en un lugar turístico de mucha afluencia, el cual administra su esposa y sus hijos. Oscar desea seguir mejorando su negocio ya que sabe que es la mayor fuente de ingresos familiar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas, arroz, frijoles, pollo, tomates, Chile verde, zanahoria, etc.
texts.en:
Oscar is 44 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his two children, a 23-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old son. His 11-month grandson also lives with them. He is a hard-working man who makes a living as a driver for a nearby company. In addition, he has a business that sells miscellaneous products and food in a place of great touristic inflow, which is managed by his wife and children.

Oscar wishes to continue improving his business, since he knows that it is the greatest source of family income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy beverages, rice, beans, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, etc.

loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, beans, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es:
Hipolita de 52 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es una mujer luchadora que desde muy pequeña trabajó duro para criar a sus hijos y darles el estudios ya que ella no  tuvo la oportunidad, ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan económicamente a ella.

Ella necesita el crédito para mejorar la vivienda, comprará arena, 15 bolsas de cemento y 2 quintales de hierro.


Su sueño es seguir trabajando con la institución y mejorar aún mas su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hipolita is 52 years old. She makes a living performing household chores. She is a fighter who, starting at an early age, worked hard to raise her children and give them an education, since she did not have that opportunity. They are now adults, and they help her financially.

She needs a loan to make improvements to her house. She will buy sand, 15 bags of cement, and 2 quintals of iron.

Her dream is to continue working with the institution and to improve her house even more.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house. She will buy sand, 15 bags of cement, and 2 quintals of iron.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 56 years old and married. Estrelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Estrelita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrelita has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Estrelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber sales business in the Philippines. Eufracia has been in this business for 20 years. Eufracia earns additional income by working at a general store.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell in her lumber yard. Eufracia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional lumber to sell in her lumber yard

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and is married with five children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns additional income by selling firewood.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Notably, Gemma has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. In the future, Gemma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada de 40 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar conformado por ella y sus cuatro hijos, ella posee una tienda, en la cual vende diferentes productos de primera necesidad y tiene 4 años de experiencia y está ubicado en su lugar de vivienda, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, Ada solicita un crédito parta la compra de mas productos para su tienda como: gaseosas, golosinas, huevos, arroz, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ada is 40 years old. She lives with her family, which consists of her and her four children. She owns a store, where she sells a variety of basic staples. She has 4 years of experience, and it is located in the place where she lives. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to meet the needs of her home.

Ada is requesting a loan to buy more products for her store such as sodas, snacks, eggs, rice, etc. in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, eggs, rice, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman who works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, Gloria runs a general store business in the Philippines. Gloria has been in this business for five years now.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her general store business by purchasing additional groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 26 years old and is married with two children. With two children currently in school, Ivy works very hard to provide for her family.

Ivy runs a general store in the Philippines. Ivy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, including bread, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent, and soap.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. In the future, Ivy would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to expand and improve her general store business by purchasing additional inventory (bread, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, etc.) to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retail business in the Philippines. Josefina explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through 17 prior loans from NWTF. She earns additional income by selling food items.

Josefina is now seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell for her gasoline retail business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
