loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional containers of gasoline to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joy is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Joy has a native bag weaving business in the Philippines. Joy requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Joy has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: Evelin de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella esta solicitando un crédito para a compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Evelin is 37 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She has worked selling clothing for 3 years. Her business is located in her place of residence, and she also sells as a traveling saleswoman in the different cities. She is requesting a loan to buy more women and men clothing at wholesale prices, so she can continue with her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more women and men clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, poles, and to pay for hand labor.

loans.name: Saikot Group

texts.en:
Siemte is a 40-year-old energetic woman pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured borrower of the group. She weaves different patterns of traditional wraparounds and shawls as a means of sustenance for her livelihood, while her husband is a daily wage earner in construction work. His work is unreliable because he works on a temporary basis only when there is a requirement. The eldest son works in a private company to support himself, while the other three children go to school in their hometown. 

Siemte’s household income is scarce, and they can hardly manage to provide for the family requirements and school fees. As they could not manage the family’s expenditures with their meagre income, Siemte initiated weaving for longer hours and extended her weaving hours until late evenings so that she could weave more products and generate more income. For the improvement of her business and her children’s study, Siemte wants to avail herself of a loan amounting to 12,173 INR for a 45-watt solar light. 

Siemte says she is inspired by those villages where solar lights are installed and that experience an increase in their economic activity levels. Installing solar lights in villages allows businesses to operate during the evening and nighttime. Therefore, she believes that solar electricity will help to promote her enterprise, as she can use the system to provide lighting to operate during the evening and night. At the same time, the children can study in a brighter room with better concentration on their lessons. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva, for the loan.” 

Like her, the rest of the group members also need solar home lighting for their respective income-generating activities and household use. Their main activities are weaving, variety shop, etc.

loans.use: to buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system that will light up four light bulbs up to twelve hours a day and help her to weave for longer hours.

loans.name: Oscar Alfonso

texts.es: Oscar de 36 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el cliente trabaja de albañil en distintos proyectos y trabajos por obra, tiene ya 10 años de experiencia como albañil, con los trabajos que él hace lleva el sustento a su hogar, Oscar quiere colocar piso y puertas a los cuartos de su vivienda pero no le alcanza para poder hacerlo, por esa razón solicita  un crédito para comprar  cerámica, laminas, cemento, balcones, etc. ahí donde muestra la fotografía para poder vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Oscar is 36 years old. He lives with his domestic partner and their two children. The client works as a mason in different projects and commissioned jobs. He has already more than 10 years of experience as a mason. With his jobs he supports his household. Oscar wants to put floor and doors to the rooms of his house, but he does not enough money to do so. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy ceramic, metal sheets, cement, balconies, etc. Shown on the photograph is where he wants to put the floor so they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, metal sheets, cement, balconies, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and married with four children. With all 3 children currently in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Maribel has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, etc. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tegawende Sa Group

texts.fr:
Mme Mariam est la représentante du groupe TEGAWENDE SA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants, le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Madame est restauratrice depuis 07 ans. Elle  s’approvisionne dans  le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 01 sac de riz, 05 plats d’arachides, 02 choux, 02 aubergines.
Mme Mariam veut utiliser ses bénéfices, pour aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand restaurant améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam is the representative of the group TEGAWENDE SA. She is in good health. A married mother, she has four children. The oldest is 17, and the youngest is 2. Three go to school. She has four persons to support. 

Ms. Mariam has been a restauranteur for seven years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of her district. She wants to purchase a sack of rice, 5 platters of peanuts, 2 cabbages, and 2 eggplants. She wants to use her profits to help cover her children’s schooling. Her ambition is to open a large restaurant and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, 5 platters of peanuts, 2 cabbages, and 2 eggplants

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with fourteen children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 58 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Rosalinda has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Bunty

texts.en: Bunty is 25 years old, a cashier at a hotel and a student at a university. He lives with his parents in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He has been a cashier since 2013 earning $3 per day. Because of a lack of financial support, Bunty would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to have his own business and buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Guillerma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Guillerma has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is widowed and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lilia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Annabelle has been in this business for one year now.

Annabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 26 years old and has one child. Lucita is married and has one child who is in school.

Lucita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Lucita has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a buy-and-sell tobacco business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers.

Rosita has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 48 years old and has nine children. Vilma is married and has two children who are still in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Angela is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Angela has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and has three children. Maricel is married and has two of children currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 51 years old and has two children still in school.

Editha has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Editha has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Marjorie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Marjorie has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marjorie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a frozen foods and meat vending business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods and meat to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods and meat to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gwendelina

texts.en:
Gwendelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Gwendelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like needles, fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

Gwendelina has been in this business for 40 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like needles, fabric, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and single. 

Wilma is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: La venta de películas,discos compactos DVDs y mercancía son los negocios con los cuales genera sus ingresos Ana, de 37 años, que habita con sus dos hijos en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ana desde hacen 5 años inició su negocio pues ya tenia experiencia en esta actividad trabajando con otras personas, pero solo hasta cuando su hijo le propuso acompañarla en viajes para ganar dinero, ella pensó en emprenderle a su hijo su propio negocio, comprándole DVD televisores y peliculas, para que las ofreciera, posteriormente compró 2 computadores y empezó haciendo servicios de transcripciones y trabajos en internet, aprovechando que tenia un colegio muy cerca a asu casa que potencializaba la venta. Gradualmente ha ido virando su negocio hacia la venta de peliculas y viaja a otras ciudades de  Colombia, de donde trae ropa, calzado, y productos de aseo.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito todos los días, de 7 de la mañana a 10 de la noche, comprando de contado en almacenes especializados en las mercancías que vende a los clientes del barrio y de sus alrededores. Su meta mas adelante es tener una panadería, para genera mas ingresos y ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora y una impresora para ofrecer una vez mas un mejor servicio al cliente con estos equipos que hoy no tiene y mejorar aun mas su nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Selling movies, records, compact DVDs, and merchandise are the businesses with which Ana generates income.  She is 37 years old and lives with her two children in a municipality very close to the city of Barranquilla.

Ana started her business five years ago.  She had experience in this business activity by working with other people.  However, it was only when her son proposed that he accompany her on her trips to earn money that she thought about undertaking her son's own business by purchasing DVD players and movies to sell.

She later bought two computers and started offering transcription services and jobs on the internet.  She took advantage of having a school very close to her house to make the most of her sales.

She has gradually been turning her business towards the sale of movies.  She travels to other cities in Colombia where she brings clothes, shoes, and toiletries.  She sells for cash and for credit every day from seven in the morning until ten at night.  She buys for cash at stores that specialize in the merchandise that she sells to her neighbors and people in surrounding areas.

Her goal for later on is to have a bakery in order to generate more income and to see her children become successful professionals.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy a photocopier and a printer in order to offer, once again, a better service to her customers.  With this equipment, that she now does not have, she will increase her level of sales even more.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and a printer.

loans.name: Azmabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Azmabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Azmabeth is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stall for her buy-and-sell fruits business.

Azmabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stall.

loans.name: Noomwende Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Issaka est le représentant du groupe NOOMWENDE  SILGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé a 14 ans. 05 vont à l’école. Il a 30 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 40 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 05 moutons.
Mr Issaka veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour se soigner et scolariser ses enfants. Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Issaka is the representative of the group NOOMWENDE SILGO. He is in good health. A married father, he has five children. The oldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 14. Five go to school. He has 30 persons to support. 

Mr. Issaka has been a livestock farmer for forty years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. His customers are merchants in his district. 

He wants to purchase 5 sheep. 

He wants to use his profits for educating and taking care of his children. His ambition is to open a store.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sheep

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de neuf membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
Mbène, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale de l'embouche bovine. En parallèle, elle fait le commerce. cette dernière activité va lui permettre de payer ses intérêts et aussi de renforcer son épargne.
Elle compte investir les 200000 F dans l'embouche bovine. Elle achète le bœuf aux alentours de 150000, payer les soins vétérinaires et acheter les aliments avec les 50000 F. Elle compte revendre entre 325000 et 350000 F. Les 50000 F qui restent seront investit dans le commerce. Elle achète 03 bidons d'huile de 20 litres à 13500 F le bidon, 04 caisses de savons de 50 morceaux chaque à 5000 F la caisse. Elle compte revendre l'huile à 800 F le litre et le savon à 150 F le morceaux où 6500 F la caisse.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre d'assurer son quotidien, de participer à des tontines et aussi de payer ses intérêts et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of nine members is part of the ’banc villageois’ which was created on June 4, 2011. It is composed of members living in and around the same village. The members get along well and have solidarity. Their main work involves commerce and the fattening of livestock. 

Mbène, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 31 years old. She is a married mother of seven children, including four boys. Her main work involves fattening cattle. In parallel, she works in commerce, which will enable her to pay the loan interest and also to bolster her savings. 

She intends to invest the 200,000 francs in the fattening cattle. She purchases a steer for about 150,000 francs, pays for veterinary care, and buys feed with the 50,000 francs. She plans on reselling it between 325,000 and 350,000 francs. The remaining 50,000 francs will be invested in commerce. She is purchasing three 20-liter containers of oil at 13,500 francs each, and four 50-piece cases of bar soap at 5,000 francs per case. She plans on reselling the oil at 800 francs per liter and the soap at 150 francs each or 6,500 francs per case. 

The profits will enable her to ensure her day-to-day expenses are covered, to participate in tontines, and also to pay the loan interest, as well as bolster her savings.

loans.use: to fatten cattle

loans.name: Normie

texts.en:
Normie works hard to support her family. Normie is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Normie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Normie has been in this business for one year now.

Normie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 52 years old and has two of her children still in school.

Evelyn has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is 28 years old and has three children. Vangie is married and has two children of her children currently in school.

Vangie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vangie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vangie has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vangie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joyce is 33 years old and has both two children in school.

Joyce has a buy-and-sell mango business in the Philippines. Joyce requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more mangos to sell to her customers.

Joyce has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Joyce would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more mangos to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anaclita has been in this business for two years. Anaclita earns more income from pig fattening.

Anaclita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 63 years old and married with four children. Apolonia works very hard to provide for them.

Apolonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, vinegar, canned goods, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell.

Apolonia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, vinegar, canned goods, sugar, eggs, etc. 

Apolonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, vinegar, canned goods, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell for her fruit-vending business.

Julinda has been in this business for ten years. Julinda earns more income from her general store.

Julinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
From Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, Sok, 56, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of one dependent child and two married children. She is the owner of a small rice field. By operating farming business, she can earn around $5.00 USD a day to support her family's daily expands. So far, she has been involved in this career for thirty-four years.

To keep her rice growing well with more crops, Sok is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process in this farming season. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her rice growing better and produce more crops for her.  She also thanks to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en: Sreypao is 18 years old, a student and she lives with her parents in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Sreypao would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she hopes to have a good job with reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Nabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
Tenning,debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, toutes des filles. Elle fait comme activité l'embouche bovine. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. En parallèle, elle fait du commerce.
Elle achète un bœuf à 150000 F qu'elle compte revendre entre 200000 et 250000 F. Avec le reste de l'argent, elle achète des aliments pour bétails, paie les frais vétérinaires et investit dans le commerce d'habillement pour enfants qui durant cette période de préparation de la Tabaski lui sera très rentable. Cette activité parallèle va lui permettre de payer ses intérêts et renforcer son épargne.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va renforcer son épargne et assurer son quotidien et ses besoins personnelles.
texts.en:
This group is part of the ’banc villageois’ which was created on June 4, 2011. It is composed of members living in and around the same village. The members get along well and have solidarity. Their main work involves commerce and the fattening of livestock. 

Tenning, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 24 years old. She is a married mother of six children, all girls. Her main work involves fattening cattle. She has been in this business for a long time and has good experience in this domain. In parallel, she works in commerce.

She is purchasing a steer at 150,000 francs and intends to resell it between 200,000 and 250,000 francs. With the remaining money, she is purchasing animal feed, paying the veterinary fees, and investing in the commerce of children’s clothing, which will be very profitable during this time period in preparing for the Tabaski holiday. Her business will at the same time allow her to pay her loan interest and bolster her savings. 

With the profits, she is going to bolster her savings and ensure her day-to-day expenses are covered, as well as to support herself.

loans.use: to fatten livestock and work in commerce

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en:
Berlyn is 23 years old and married with one child.  

Berlyn is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Berlyn requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Berlyn has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Berlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 48 years old and has three children. Candelaria is married and all three children are in school.

Candelaria is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Candelaria requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Candelaria has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Candelaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
Yacine, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 04 filles. Elle fait comme activité l'embouche ovine. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine et s'en sort parfaitement bien.
Elle achète 03 brebis avec leurs agneaux entre 35000 et 40000 F. Elle achète aussi des aliments et paie les frais vétérinaires avec le reste de l'argent. Au bout de quatre mois, elle revend les brebis à 45 000 F l'une et les agneaux après les avoir élevés pendant une durée d'un an, elle les revend à 100000 F l'un. Cette activité est très rentable selon elle.
Les bénéfices servent à améliorer son quotidien. Elle aide son mari dans la dépense quotidienne, les frais scolaires, médicaux et vestimentaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 21 members is part of the ’banc villageois’ which was created on June 4, 2011. It is composed of members living in and around the same village. The members get along well and have solidarity. Their main work involves commerce and the fattening of livestock. 

Yacine, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 42 years old. She is a married mother of eight children, including four girls. Her business involves fattening sheep. She has been in this business for a long time, has good experience in this domain, and is managing incredibly well. 

She is purchasing 3 ewes with their lambs between 35,000 and 40,000 francs. She is also purchasing some feed and paying the veterinary fees with the rest of the money. After four months, she is reselling the ewes at 45,000 francs each; and the lambs, after having raised them for a year, at 100,000 francs each. This business is, according to her, very profitable. 

The profits are used to improve her daily life. She helps out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses and the children’s schooling, medical, and clothing costs.

loans.use: to fatten sheep

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, a father of three, lives in the remote village of Mosobeti in Nyamira, an area known to have high demand for poultry products. Richard practices mixed farming, growing bananas, tea and a variety of food crops. Of all the activities in which he is involved, poultry farming is closest to his heart. Waking up every morning to collect eggs makes him very proud. Feeding his poultry is his hobby. 

Richard has always wanted to increase his poultry farming operation because the demand is overwhelming, but the biggest challenge has been lack of capital. Richard has traits of a mobilizer, and he decided to mobilize other small scale farmers who share this common problem. Together, they joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that uses a co-guarantee mechanism to provide agricultural-based loans. Richard is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. With the loan, he will be able to buy more poultry and satisfy the overwhelming demand. Through the loan he will significantly increase his sales and this will translate to more profits. 

Demand for chicken is high in Nyamira; it is a popular meal for many people, and fast food joints are always full. Increased profits will allow Richard to improve his living conditions and get out of the poverty-stricken situation he is currently in. Other than profits, he will also benefit from poultry manure, which has higher nitrogen than other livestock manure. Through the loan, Richard sees a brighter future. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Joy Hope Women Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Joy Hope Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained on financial management, enterprise development, and savings mobilization to help sharpen their business skills. The members in this group are mostly involved in farming activities.

The person raising her hand is Jane. She is 41 years old, married and living with her husband and one of her three children. She raises kale, beans, and maize in her small land; and also does dairy farming. She has applied for a loan to buy certified seeds so that she can help improve the crops' yield. She hopes for improved income, thus be in a position to feed her family.

She is very happy with this loan and is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds

loans.name: Tulaga Muruaki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary, a member of the Tulaga Muruaki Self Help Group. She is thirty two years old and a mother of three children. All of her children attend school.

Mary earns her living by operating a food kiosk selling fruits and vegetables such as bananas, pawpaws, and onions. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained more about business management, record keeping, and financial management.

She is borrowing a loan to help her boost her business by adding more stock of fruits and vegetables. This will enable her support the rising demand of her customers. She hopes for improved income, thus be able to cater for her children's education. She is happy for this loan and grateful to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fruits and vegatables.

loans.name: Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group

texts.en:
Peninah, the person raising her hand in the photo, is a member of the Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group. She is thirty eight years old, married and blessed with two children whom she lives with.

Peninah earns her living by practicing dairy farming in her village. She joined Hand in Hand in 2012 and has benefited from savings, enterprise and financial management training. She is applying for a loan to purchase animal feeds. She looks forward to improved milk production, hence increased income. She hopes to use the anticipated income in educating her children.

Peninah is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Teresia. She is fifty-four years old, married and blessed with eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012.

She operates a tailoring business. She is borrowing a loan to purchase more textile fabric. She is happy for the enterprise training she received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa which has helped her gain business knowledge and skills in operating her business. She hopes this will enable her to satisfy her customers' rising demand. This will raise her income which will enable her to cater for her family needs such as paying school fees for the children.

Teresia is happy for the support of Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase textile fabric.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Kiva Lenders! Meet Emmanuel, aged 30, who lives in Kurgong, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Kurgong area is an area where hard core poverty pervades every home, yet every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people: a sea of about 5,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. They are like the bones in the “valley of dry bones” that required only a breath to spring back to life. Armed with this conviction, Emmanuel has been toiling in his farm for the past 4 years. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that he engages in to the make ends meet. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. 

He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. Emmanuel passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit the from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Emmanuel waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Convenant

texts.en: Convenant is a repeat client to the organization and is securing a loan of 3.500.000.  She is a single mother with one child. She comes from a village in Rwerere parish, Nyakagyeme sub-county, Rukungiri district. She is a hard working and deals in cattle fattening and an electronic shop as her main source of income. She relied on it for her financial needs but found that her business alone cannot meet all her needs including tuition for her young sisters; that’s why she decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance. She has approached UGAFODE for the financial assistance to buy building materials like cement, sand, doors to complete her residential house. Convevant praises Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled her to sustain her business and accumulate assets like building a house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for her house

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
This is Samuel, married and blessed with four children. He practices both vegetable and dairy farming. He has applied for a loan to buy high quality cabbage seeds, to improve on his crop yield, and dairy feed, which will increase milk production and hence increase his income. 

He plans to use the profits to cater for his family's needs such as food and clothing. He will also plough back some profits to help maintain a stable farming business.

Samuel appreciates Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and dairy feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a cow shed

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una carpintería.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser y con un poco de esfuerzo puso su propia carpintería. Ruben  tiene 19 años de edad, es unido y tiene un hijo de tan solo tres meses de nacido, el hijo de Ruben se ha convertido en el motivo de la lucha de trabajar cada día para brindarles un futuro mejor y una mejor condición de vida.
	
Durante 6 años ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de carpintero en su casa de habitación ubicado en su comunidad, también teniendo una segunda actividad como agricultor en su comunidad, el es un joven emprendedor y con grandes visiones hacia el futuro y a tomado todo los obstáculos de la vida le a puesto como un requisito para poder alcanzar el éxito. 

Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como block y hierro para la construcción de su vivienda y  es para  la realización de su más grande sueño en la construcción de una vivienda para tener las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de Ruben es poder vender sus productos en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el  realiza, he dar estudios a su hijo para que llegue a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Life gave him an opportunity to work as an employee of a carpentry shop. It was what he was waiting for, not only for the open door but also for what was behind that door. What he found was something that defined what he wanted to be and with a bit of effort he set up his own carpentry shop. Ruben is 19 years old, in a relationship and has a son who was born just three months ago. Ruben’s son has become the reason for his working struggle each day to provide them with a better future and a better quality of life. 

He has been working very hard and been dedicated to his carpentry job which he runs out of his home located in his community. He also has a second job in his community as a farmer. He is a young entrepreneur with great vision towards the future. He has taken on all of the obstacles that life has given him as a prerequisite to be able to achieve success.

The purpose for him taking out a loan is to buy building materials such as cement blocks and iron for constructing his home. It is also to carry out his biggest dream to build a home in order to have suitable living conditions. 

One of Ruben’s greatest aspirations is to be able to sell his products in his community so that people get to know the work he does. He also wants to educate his son so that he can be a working professional in life.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a repeat client of this organization and he has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. Boaz is 41 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. He comes from Rwakabengo ward, southern division in Rukungiri municipality. He has been a photographer for over ten years, and this business is his main source of income. 

Boaz has found that his business alone cannot enable him to meet all his financial needs and also enable him to build his own house. The purpose of this loan is to buy building materials including cement and iron sheets, and to pay laborers so as to finish his house and reduce the expense of paying rent. Boaz thanks UGAFODE for helping him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, la distancia que tenía que recorrer para ir a la escuela le impidió continuar, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene dos hijas las cuales viven con ella, la mayor va a la escuela y estudia tercer grado. 
	
Maritza tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, los engorda para luego venderlos, ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad que aprendió de sus padres, la necesidad la llevó a iniciar una fuente de ingresos, además es ama de casa y se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, frijol, maicillo, también tiene ganado, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. 

Ella necesita este crédito para construir un muro a la orilla de la calle de su casa. 

Sus sueños son preparar bien su casa para darles una buena herencia a sus hijas y darles estudios para que tenga una vida diferente a la suya.
texts.en:
Maritza is 37 years old. She has a sixth-grade education; the distance that she had to travel to get to school prevented her from continuing. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. She has two daughters who live with her; the older goes to school and is in third grade.

Maritza has a small chicken farm. She fattens them to later sell them. She has been doing this activity, which she learned from her parents, for three years now; necessity led her to create a source of income. In addition, she is a housewife and she works in agriculture. She grows corn, beans, and sorghum, and she also has livestock. Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
	
She needs this loan to build a wall between her house and the edge of the street.

Her dreams are to prepare her house well in order to give her daughters a good inheritance and to give them an education so that they can have a life different than hers.

loans.use: to build a wall between her house and the edge of the street

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Hilda, who is in her late 20's, is married with three children. Two of them are in school and one is small. She has been running two projects: selling water and fried cassava, for seven years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hilda’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the water and cassava stock, and can now sell to more customers. She has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to help her husband to pay for school, and sometimes contributes to buy food and pay household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more stock of water and more pieces of cassava to meet her customers’ demand. She dreams of owning a retail shop.

Hilda will share this loan with her loan group “Compressor”, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of water and more pieces of cassava to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Cornelius, a passionate and hardworking go-getter. He is based in Lessos, a remote village in Nandi hills, Kenya. This area is faced with hardcore poverty and very bad terrain. For the past three years, he has actively been involved in mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk and eggs. Cornelius passionately loves farming, but the biggest challenge he faces is transportation of the products to the market and timely delivery. The Nandi hills area has poor roads and the terrain makes it even worse. He faces challenges transporting his produce, especially during the rainy seasons.

Cornelius is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Because of poor feeder roads and bad terrain, this loan will assist him a great deal. Through the loan, he will be able to transport his produce from the farm and deliver it to the market on-time. Milk is very perishable and requires quick delivery to the market and through the loan, he will be able to make quick deliveries and never suffer losses. Eggs are very fragile and they require proper handling and through the motorbike, he will be able to transport his eggs using crates to the market.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports small holder farmers, Cornelius is assured that his dreams will come to pass. Cornelius has gone through financial and technical training with Juhudi Kilimo and is confident that through savings from the loan, he will improve his living conditions and repay back the loan. Cornelius plans to impact the society positively through employing someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping him in the field. This loan will be a stepping stone for the success of Cornelius.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is a repeat client at the institution. He is married with six children, four attending school. Coffee trade is his major source of business. He has done this for more than 15 years. He also deals in the cattle trade as his alternative source of income. Edison joined UGAFODE to access financial assistance to boost his business, so as to be able to meet all his financial needs like tuition and to sustain his business. Edison thanks UGAFODE because it has enabled him to build his residential house and to educate his children without affecting his business. He took this loan to buy more coffee and to be able compete favorably in the market to increase his earnings. Edison praises UGAFODE financial assistance, which has enabled him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy coffee for trade.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria a sus 41 años de edad es una mujer con muchas fuerzas y deseos de superación en la vida, curso hasta el sexto grado por lo que le da gracias a Dios por haber culminado su educación primaria a pesar de las diferentes dificultades económicas que sus padres presentaban para apoyarle ya que la situación económica no era la mejor. Se casó con don francisco un hombre muy respetuoso, luchador y muy trabajador quien se dedica al trabajo de campo y con quien procreó cinco hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella en su casa pues aun estudian el mayor de los tres está en primero de comercio, la segunda está en primero de ciclo común básico y la última esta en tercer grado pues los mayores están casados en hogares aparte. Su principal fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de arroz al cual se dedica desde hace seis años aprendiendo dicha actividad desde niña con su padre y luego poniendo en práctica sus conocimiento con en compañía de su hoy en día esposo. El terreno que trabaja una parte ha sido comprado y otra herencia por ambas partes familiares siendo sus clientes seguros y confiables dueños de bodegas, beneficios e intermediarios. Como desafíos encontrados en el trabajo de campo son las plagas las cuales con los insumos adecuados pueden ser controlables evitando el deterioro del grano y la plantación. Por lo cual solicita financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para dar la respectiva abonada así como también el pago de mano de obra para la limpia y que se dé un mejor mantenimiento. Sus planes para el futuro poder seguir incrementando su área de cultivo comprando más tierra para la sembrar y así poder ampliar el negocio al igual poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
At 41 years old, Doña Maria is a woman with great strength and a desire to improve herself in life. She has a sixth-grade education, and she thanks God that she completed primary school despite the financial difficulties that her parents faced in supporting her, as their economic situation was not the best. She married Don Francisco, a very respectful, determined, and hardworking man who earns his living doing farm work. With him, she gave birth to five children, of whom three live with her in her house, as they are still in school. The oldest of the three is in the first year of business, the second is in the first year of high school, and the last is in third grade. The older ones are married and in their own households. 

Her main source of income is growing rice, which she has done for six years, having learned this activity from the time she was a child with her father, and later putting her knowledge into practice in the company of the man who is now her husband. They purchased part of the land that they work, and the rest is an inheritance from both sides of the family. Their regular and dependable customers are shop owners, mills, and brokers. 

Among the challenges they find in farm work are infestations, which they can control with the right supplies, avoiding the deterioration of the grain and the crop. For that reason, she is requesting financing in order to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to give the appropriate nourishment, as well as to pay for manual labor for weeding and doing better maintenance.

Her plans for the future are to be able to keep expanding her crops by buying more land to plant, and also to be able to expand her business as well as to be able to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay manual labor to tend to her rice crop

loans.name: Kuluipa

texts.ru: Кулуйпа, 57 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 3 детей, они все взрослые и проживают отдельно. Образование среднее. Кулуйпа начала заниматься сельским хозяйством много лет назад с покупки одной коровы. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 2 коровы, 2 овцы. Также Кулуйпа выращивает ячмень на 0,50 ГА арендованной и 0,70 ГА собственной земли. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет Кулуйпе разводить скот и заготавливать для него корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулуйпа обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной нетели. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства, а также на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kuluipa is 57, married, and the mother of three children who are all grown-up and living on their own.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and has worked as a farmer for many years.  She started with a single cow, and now has two cows and two sheep, as well as 0.50 hectares of rented land and 0.70 of her own for growing barley.  The money she earns allows her to raise livestock and prepare stores of fodder for the winter.  To further develop her farm, she is seeking a loan of 30,000 som from Bai-Tushum & Partners to buy a heifer.  She plans on reinvesting any extra income due to the loan back into her farm, and hopes to build a new barn for her animals in particular.

loans.use: buy a heifer to be more profitable and build a barn for livestock

loans.name: Nelly Marina

texts.es:
Nelly de 56 años de edad, no terminó el bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la siembra de maíz.

Nelly se dedica a los oficios domésticos, luego que salió de estudiar obtuvo empleo como obrera en una fábrica de jabón pero por motivos de la guerra tuvo que regresar a su domicilio, luego consiguió empleo como promotora de salud en donde trabajó por cinco años y posteriormente trabajó como alfabetizadora por más de siete años.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos a su cultivo de maíz.

Ella sueña con vivir feliz al lado de su compañero de vida y ver que sus hijos se superen y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Nelly is 56 years old. She did not finish high school. She is married, and her husband earns his living growing corn.

Nelly is a housewife. After she left school, she got a job as a worker in a soap factory, but because of the war, she had to go back home. Then she got a job as a healthcare representative. She worked there for five years, and later worked as a literacy tutor for more than seven years.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies to apply to their corn crop. She dreams of living happily alongside her life companion and watching her children improving themselves and being respectable people.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to apply to her corn crop

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 41 years old and married with three children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Marivic has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak, 33 years old, is living in a small village of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. She has two dependent children. So far, she has been involved in this career for around twenty years with the average income of USD 3.00 a day.

Currently, she is borrowing a Kiva loan, which is her first circle loan, to buy a plot of farmland. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can increase her income and make her life get better. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es:
Rosa de 42 años de edad, solo estudió hasta noveno grado, no siguió con sus estudios por motivos económicos, pero ella con esfuerzo está dándole estudios a sus hijos menores para que sean profesionales, sus hijos mayores ya no dependen de ella.


Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa, ella vende productos para el hogar, se ha dedicado por mas de 5 años a este oficio y lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender en el negocio y el horario de atención es de  6:00 am a 6:00 pm.


Ella necesita el crédito para ampliar mas la tienda y comprar mas productos de la canasta básica, porque en el lugar hay bastante demanda de clientes y con eso ella pretende generar mas ganancias para poder suplir las necesidades del hogar.

Sus sueños son prosperar con su familia en el negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old and only has a ninth-grade education. She couldn't continue her studies because of economic reasons, but with a lot of hard work she is making a good education possible for her young children so they can become professionals. Her older children already are independent. Rosa has had a general store selling household products for more than five years, learning the trade on her own initiative. One of her daughters helps her with the business, which she tends from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. She needs the loan to expand her store and purchase more general supplies because customer demand is quite high and she wants to generate more income to be able to better meet her household needs. Her dreams are for her family to prosper along with her business and for her children to become successful professionals.

loans.use: to expand her store and purchase more general supplies.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin es una persona que viene desde el continente europeo a Medellín buscando mejores alternativas, logro montar su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas gracias al apoyo de ONG europeas y desde entonces vende hamburguesas, perros, salchipapas, cervezas, jugos en barrio nuevo. 
Buscando mejorar y que su negocio sea más reconocido en el sector Edwin quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos y surtido como carne, papas, salchichas, gaseosas y cervezas. 
Edwin quiere crecer como empresa poder generar recursos para mandarle dinero al hijo que dejo en el continente europeo y poder tener recursos para traerlo a vivir junto con él.
texts.en: Edwin came to Medellin from Europe looking for better opportunities, and he was able to start his own fast food business thanks to the support of European nonprofit groups, and since then he has sold hamburgers, hotdogs, sausages, french fries, beer and juices in Barrio Nuevo. He is looking to make improvements to bring more attention to his business. Edwin is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients and stock his store with meat, potatoes, sausages, soft drinks and beer. He wants to grow his business to earn money to send to his son, who stayed in Europe. Edwin wants to be able to have the means to bring him back to live with him.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, potatoes and sausages, as well as soft drinks and beer, to earn money to bring his son back from Europe to live with him.

loans.name: Chanseng

texts.en: In the photo, the small boy is the borrower's neighbor’s child. Chanseng is 27 years old, a married woman with no children living in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. She fattens piglets to resell. She has worked in animal husbandry since 2011. Her husband is a 47-year-old taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $12.30 daily. Now Chanseng would like to request a loan to build a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family a hygienic living. In the future, she is going to buy a new taxi for her husband and build fences around her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Alfredo Isaac

texts.es:
Alfredo de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado, actualmente está acompañado y tiene una hija de dos años de edad.


Alfredo se dedica a trabajar en una ferretería, tiene 6 meses de laborar como despachador y descargador de bodega, el lugar de trabajo está a 5 km de su casa y viaja en bus, Alfredo comienza a trabajar desde las 7:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar madera y 1,200 tejas para comenzar a construir su casa.

Su sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir trabajando fuerte en la ferretería y tener su propia casa ya que por el momento vive en la de su suegro.
texts.en: Alfredo is 23 years old and has a seventh-grade education. He is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. He makes a living working for a hardware supplier, and he has six months of experience working as a dispatcher and unloader at a warehouse. His work is five kilometers from his home and he commutes by bus. He works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. He is requesting the loan to purchase wood and 1,200 bricks to begin construction on a home. His dream is to stay in good health so he can continue being a strong worker for the hardware supplier and to have his own home, because at the moment he is living with his father-in-law.

loans.use: to purchase wood and 1,200 bricks to begin construction on his home.

loans.name: Pioneras Group

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 13 años y su negocio es el comercio de pan y tortas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, trabajadora, buena madre, y muy responsable. Su labor la realiza en la zona 'plan 3000’ donde sus pobladores; la mayoría son migrantes del occidente o hijos de migrantes.
Marlene es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (la tercera de la derecha, blusa morada, lentes rojos, agarrando una bolsa rosada). La necesidad de continuar con su labor la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo. Su trabajo es la elaboración de pan y tortas, ella tiene una panadería en un cuarto de su casa, dónde realiza variedad de panes y algunas tortas, para venderlas de forma ambulante y también a clientes constantes como tiendas de barrio. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y su hijo que asiste a la escuela. Su sueño es abrir un snack de comida rápida y agrandar su panadería. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su panadería comprando materiales como; un horno industrial y moldes para tortas, así aumentaría su producción y generaría mejores ingresos económicos para pagar la educación de su hijo.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y moldes para tortas.
texts.en:
Marlene is 46 years old and lives with her partner. She has a 13-year-old son, and a business producing bread and cakes.

Marlene is enterprising independent, hard-working, very responsible and a good mother. She works in the Plan 3000 area of Santa Cruz where the majority of inhabitants have migrated from the west, or are the off-spring of immigrants.

Marlene has dark skin, is of medium height, and has long dark hair. Her native tongue is Spanish but she also speaks Guarani, having learned it from her elders. (In the photo, Marlene is third from the right, wearing a purple top and red glasses.) A need to continue with her work has brought Marlene to apply for a loan at this bank for people with different businesses and similar needs. Marlene works producing bread and cakes. She has a bakery in a room of her house where she prepares a variety of types of bread and some cakes to sell both as a street vendor and to regular customers such as local grocery stores.

Marlene shares her life with her partner and her son, who is in school. Marlene's dream is to open a fast-food restaurant and to expand her bakery. 

Marlene wants to invest in her bakery by buying materials such as an industrial oven and cake moulds. With these items, Marlene can increase production and generate a higher income in order to pay for her son's education.

For these reasons Marelene is applying for a loan in order to buy an industrial oven and cake moulds.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and cake moulds.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат, 28 лет, разведена, детей нет.  У Рахат высшее образование, она работает в микрокредитной компании уже более двух лет, ее ежемесячный доход около 16,000 сом. Рахат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на проведение ремонта ее дома, а именно покупку гипсокартона, линолеума и прочих строительных материалов. Кредитные средства помогут улучшить жилищные условия Рахат и ее семьи.
texts.en: Rahat is 28 years old, divorced, and she has no children. She has a higher education and she has been working for a micro-finance organization for more than two years already.  She makes a monthly income of about 16,000 som.  She has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to request a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to perform some repairs in her house and in particular to buy drywall, linoleum and other construction materials.  Thanks to this loan, Rahat will be able to improve her living conditions as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and make some improvements in her house.

loans.name: Kcemeun

texts.en:
From Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, Kcemeun, 51, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of two dependent children and two married children. She is the owner of a small plantation. On her plantation she grows corns, cassava, and chili.  She has been farming for nearly twenty years, with an average income of USD 5 a day.

Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via HKL to buy cassava seeds and fertilizer to use in her farming. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: James

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, James, age 36, works hard to support his family. He buys vegetables, such as onions and carrots, from local farmers and takes them to the city market. 

James is taking a loan to expand his business by adding more stock to his vegetable business, which he has been operating for the last two years. He has gained more customers in his enterprise and needs to ensure a consistent supply. He hopes that his business will flourish and go a long way in helping him to support his family by providing food and clothing.

James is happy for the support from Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of vegetables, such as onions and carrots.

loans.name: 95 United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Pauline; she is a member of 95 United Self Help Group in Limuru, Kenya. She is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings, which have helped her realize her strength in business. She engages in mixed farming of vegetables, dairy and poultry.

She is borrowing a loan to boost her farming business by buying poultry feed and manure since demand for produce is currently high. She believes this will increase her profits, which in turn will help support her children's education by paying for their school fees and school uniforms.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and manure.

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANKELE ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TION/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANKELE sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. AWA, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20Kgs d’oignon, 10Litres d’huile, 2 paquets de Cube Maggi, 5Kgs de Sel, 10Kgs de beurre de karité et 5Kgs de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Kankele Group average 38 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Tion / Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell cereals and condiments. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Kankele Group are seeking their eighth solidarity loan (group loan).

Awa is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 kg of onions, 10 liters of cooking oil, 2 packs of Maggi bouillon cubes, 5 kg of salt, 10 kg of shea butter, and 5 kg of chili peppers.

She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers, and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, cooking oil, bouillon cubes, salt, shea butter, and of chili peppers

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame RAMATA est née en mars 1967 à KOULIKORO, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, elle réside sous couvert de son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à LOBOUGOULA un des villages dans le cercle  de Sikasso. 
RAMATA après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des cartes de recharge de crédit et le Zèrè: vente en détail de crédits à partie d'un téléphone avec l’opérateur Orange et le Paani : vente en détail à partir de 50 fcfa des crédits par l'opérateur Malitel. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans la ville de Sikasso (où il y'a les représentations des opérateurs téléphoniques).
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso un sixième prêt individuel commerçant. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des quantités importantes de cartes de recharge de crédit et les cartes de crédits lui permettant de faire le zèrè et le paani à LOBOUGOULA à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 285 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Madame Ramata was born in March 1967 in Koulikoro. She is married and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband in a traditional family in Lobougoula, a town in Sikasso Cercle in third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.
After working on a number of unsuccessful businesses, Madame Ramata began selling mobile credit recharge cards (Zèrè, Paani). She buys her supplies in the city of Sikasso in Bamako.
In order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele, she is asking the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for a sixth individual business loan. Her previous loans have been repaid.
This loan will allow her to buy a large quantity of mobile credit recharge cards (Zèrè, Paani) so that she can resell them for retail prices in Lobougoula to a clientele of men and women for cash and for credit.
She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 285,000 FCFA per month. This income will allow her to pay back her loan and interest and to add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy mobile credit recharge cards (Zèrè, Paani)

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur vingt-deuxième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  KADIATOU  debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes CONFIANCE, fait la vente des condiments. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt des quantités importantes de condiments d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of Confiance ["Confidence"] Group are married women who, on average, are 34 years old and have an average of four children each. They live mainly in traditional families in Ouayerma, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. These women are on their twenty-second group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.
Mrs. Kadiatou, the first one standing in the photo of the group, left to right, sells vegetables. With her loan, she plans to purchase large quantities of condiments, since she is highly sought-after by her customers for the quality of her products, [sold] at retail prices at the market to a group of customers made up of men and women for cash and credit.
Mrs. Kadiatou expects to see an average monthly benefit of 30,000 CFA francs, one part of which will be used to [re]pay the loan and its interest, and the other part of which she will save.

loans.use: To purchase spices and condiments for her business

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan tiene 33 años de edad, estudió bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

Juan se dedica a trabajar la tierra, él cultiva maíz y ya tiene 12 Años de realizar esta actividad que su padre le enseñó, también trabaja como bodeguero en una ferretería, Juan trabaja de 6:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm y viaja en bus.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, sulfato, herbicidas y pagar la mano de obra.

Él sueña con tener buena salud para seguir trabajando fuerte y darle la atención necesaria.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old. He finished high school. He is in a relationship and his partner is dedicated to housework. They have five children who are in school.

Juan is dedicated to working the land. He grows maize and already has 12 years experience with this work which his father taught him. He also works as strorekeeper at a hardware store. Juan works from 6AM until 5PM and travels by bus.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural resources like fertilizer, sulfates, herbicides and to pay laborers.

He dreams of having good health in order to keep working hard and to give his work the necessary attention.

loans.use: to buy agricultural resources like fertilizer, sulfates, herbicides and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like pillowcases, quilts and clothes to have her own business to make an income to support her two children.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 53 años de edad, no posee ningún grado académico ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos necesarios, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores y solo una nieta depende de él.

Francisco se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y maicillo, tiene 32 Años de realizar esta actividad que su padre le enseñó, él  sale a trabajar de 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde y debe caminar 45 minutos para llegar al lugar.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, sulfato, herbicidas y pagar la mano de obra para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de maíz y frijol.

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y seguir apoyando a su nieta en los estudios.
texts.en:
Francisco, 53, has no academic education since his parents did not have the necessary economic resources. He is married and has two children who are adults and only one granddaughter depends on him.

Francisco is dedicated to growing maize, beans and millet. He has been performing this work, which his father taught him,  for 32 years. He works from 6AM until 2PM and has to walk 45 minutes to arrive at the place.

He needs this loan to buy agricultural resources like fertilizer, sulfates, herbicides and to pay laborers to maintain the maize and bean crop.

His dream is to have good health in order to keep working and keep supporting his granddaughter with her education.
