loans.use: to buy agricultural resources like fertilizer, sulfates, herbicides and to pay laborers to maintain this maize and bean crop.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar y también se dedica a la caficultura actividades que le generan muy buenos recursos tiene  más de  2 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad  y sus clientes son muy buenos siendo estos vecinos de la misma aldea y comunidades. 
Doña Natalia esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, bolsas con agua, refrescos, huevos, etc. espera que esta inversión le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una estabilidad económica. 
                                                                                    

Trojes, Honduras Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Natalia is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and her activity is selling basic family products and she is also dedicated to coffee growing work that generates good income for her. She has more than two years experience with this type of work and her customers are very good since they are neighbors from the same town and communities.

Natalia is requesting a loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, oil, water bags, sodas, eggs, etc. She hopes that this investment will contribute to her having better stock in her business which will allow her to improve her income to cover the family expenses and financial commitments. Her dream is to improve the living conditions and have economic stability.

Trojes, Honduras. September 2014

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, oil, water bags, sodas, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, basic grains, spices, drinks, candies, etc. in order to offer better inventory to her customers.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un hombre de 65 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la reparación de aparatos electrónicos.
Él es independiente, trabajador, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘Los Andes’ un lugar caracterizado por agrupar a bordadores y artesanos que se dedican a la confección de trajes típicos.
Marcelino es de tez morena, cabello gris, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara el cual ya no utiliza y habla español para el comercio. Su trabajo es la reparación de todo tipo de aparatos eléctricos, como; televisores, equipos de sonido, licuadoras, reproductores de video, etc. También es electricista y realiza instalación y reparación de conexiones eléctricas. Su vida la comparte con su hermana la cual tampoco tiene hijos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener más clientes para mejorar su ingresos económicos, su deseo es realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelino solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a 65 year old single man who has no children and his business is repairing electronics.

He is independent, consistent, responsible and very hard working. He performs his work in the "Los Andes" area, a place characterized by groups of embroiderers and artisans who make traditional dress.

Marcelino is of dark complexion, grey hair, average stature. His mother tongue is Aymara, which is no longer used, so he speaks Spanish for business. His work is repairing all types of electronics like TVs, sound equipment, blenders, video recorders, etc. Also, he is an electrician and he installs and repairs electrical connections. He shares his life with his sister who also has no children. His dream is to expand his business and have more customers to improve his economic income. His wish is to buy a portable computer to attend better to his customers.

For those reasons, Marcelino is requesting a loan to buy a laptop and serve his customers better.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer and attend better to his customers.

loans.name: Patricia Yasmin

texts.es:
Patricia, se dedica a atender un salón de belleza, el oficio lo aprendió de su prima, hace 13 años, actualmente tiene su propio negocio, lo abre al público de Lunes a Sábado; Patricia tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, su esposo tiene 35 años de edad, aún no tienen hijos.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para comprar tintes, cosméticos, tratamientos para el cabello, accesorios de bisutería, etc., será de ayuda para ofertar más variedad de productos a sus clientes, mejorar su situación económica y así respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Sus proyectos son mantenerse trabajando para ir mejorando las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Patricia runs a beauty salon. She learned this trade from her cousin 13 years ago. Now she has her own business and she is open to the public Monday through Saturday. Patricia is 33 years old. She is married and her husband is 35. They don't have children yet.   

She will use the loan to buy dyes, cosmetics, hair treatments, jewelry accessories, etc. It will be a big help to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, to improve her financial situation and thus guarantee the payment of the debt.    

Her objective is to continue working to improve her family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy dyes, cosmetics, hair treatments, jewelry accessories, etc. It will help to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario de 34 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan el cual se realiza a diario por las mañanas y la tarde, tiene 4 años de experiencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas solicita un crédito para mejoras su vivienda el  necesita cambiar las ventanas y unas puertas ahi donde muestra la fotografía, ya que con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por es razón solicita dicho crédito para comprar balcones, cristales para ventanas, puestas y pago de mano de obra, y asi vivir con su familia seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Mario is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children. He works making and selling bread, which he does every day in the morning and in the afternoon. He has four years' experience and with what he earns from his sales, he sells he is asking for a loan to do home improvements. He needs to change the windows and some doors on the place seen in the photograph. What he earns from his job is not enough to cover it. That is why he is asking for the loan to buy balconies, glass for windows, doors, and to pay for labor. This way, he can live safely and comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy balconies, glass for windows, doors, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jovanny Andres

texts.es:
Jovanny es un humilde agricultor de café que inicio hace 3 años su negocio como independiente en la finca de su abuelo al cual como gratitud le compra los medicamentos y da sus gustos comprándole sus cosas favoritas o cualquier detalle para hacerlo feliz. 

Jovanny trabaja todos los días desde que sale el sol hasta que se esconde pero en épocas de cosechas le ayudan hasta dos personas, sus cultivos siempre le ha gustado tenerlos en excelente estado pro dicha razón quiere solicitar un crédito para poder abonar sus campos y esperar una espectacular cosecha con grandes beneficios económicos para él y para su crecimiento como empresa.

Su sueño es agrandar su cultivo tener una finca y servir siempre de apoyo para sus familiares pues algo que caracteriza a la gente del campo es que son muy humanos y compartidos por eso pedimos el apoyo de ustedes prestamistas que se disfrutan una rica taza de café a que apoyen a este muchacho que trabaja por su familia.
texts.en:
Jovanny is a humble coffee grower who started his 3 years ago as an independent on his grandfather's farm, for whom he bought medications as gratitude as well as his favorite things or any little thing to make him happy.  

Jovanny works every day from the time the sun comes up until it goes down. But during harvest time two people help him. He has always liked to have his crops in excellent condition and that is why he is asking for a loan to be able to fertilize his fields and hope for a spectacular harvest with great profits for him and for the growth of his business. 

His dream is to expand his farm and always be a support for his family. Something that characterizes people from the countryside are is that they are very humane and sharing. That is why we are asking for support from you the lenders who enjoy a delicious cup of coffee to support this man who works for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crops, hoping to have a great harvest to keep growing and bring the coffee to the family homes.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, estudio solo 1° grado, no pudo continuar ya que su padre falleció y quedó a cargo de su abuelo pero este no tenía los recursos económicos para apoyar a José a que estudiara, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos pero por el momento solo la mayor está estudiando.


José se dedica a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz, y frijol, tiene 16 años de realizar esta actividad que su abuelo le enseñó desde muy pequeño. Además trabaja como carpintero desde hace 8 años, José sale a trabajar la agricultura todas las mañana de 6:00 am hasta la 1:00 pm la cual camina 30 minutos para llegar al lugar y por las tardes se dedica a trabajar en carpintería.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, sulfato, herbicidas y pagar la mano de obra para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de maíz y frijol.

Él sueña con tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y darles buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old. He only went to first grade and couldn't continue his education because his father dies and he went into his grandfather's care but he didn't have the resources to educate José. He is married and has 2 children but right now only the oldest is in school.  

José works growing corn and beans. He has been doing this activity for 16 years. His grandfather taught it to him from the time he was very young. In addition, he has worked as a carpenter for 8 years. José goes out to work in agriculture every morning at 6:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. He walks 30 minutes to get to the place and in the afternoon he works as a carpenter.  

He needs the loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, sulphate, and herbicide, as well as to pay for labor costs to do maintenance on his corn and bean crops.  

He dreams of having good health and to keep working to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy agriculture materials such as fertilizer, sulphate, and herbicide, as well as to pay for labor costs to do maintenance on his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Rosa Alma

texts.es: Rosa de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y sus padres, ella se dedica al cultivo de yuca desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para aumentar sus cultivos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old. She lives in her own home with her daughter and her parents. She has been growing cassava for 20 years. She sells her products in the neighborhood of the area where she lives. She has many customers because of the good prices she offers and the good quality of her products. 

She asks for a loan to buy fertilizers, compost, pest control, etc. in order to increase her production and to have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
Jorge es un humilde campesino de 26 años de edad que encontró en la venta de cerdos y carne una manera de contribuir en los gastos del hogar el cual es de bajos recursos.
Con su empuje y ganas de salir adelante Jorge quiere aprovechar la oportunidad que pone interactuar en sus manos la cual es un microcrédito que invertirá en la compra de cerdos una balanza digital para pesar la carne y utensilios para realizar un excelente proceso de corte.
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara su negocio pues venderá la carne más precisa tendrá utensilios adecuados para realizar los cortes sin desperdiciar carne y solo quiere trabajar para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que es su gran deseo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a humble farmer. He is 26 years old and found in the sale of pigs and mean a way to contribute to the budget of a low income household.  

With his drive and eagerness to get ahead, Jorge wants to take advantage of the opportunity to interact that is in his hands, which is a micro loan that he will invest in buying pigs and a digital scale to weigh meat as well as utensils for an excellent cutting process. 

With the help of the loan he will improve his business because he will sell meat more precisely. He will have adequate utensils to cut the meat without wasting any. He just wants to work to improve his family's living conditions, which is his great wish.

loans.use: to buy pigs, a digital scale and utensils to cut the meat.

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benecia ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Apu Curi,” located in the Urcos district, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province, in the Cusco department.

Benecia, one of the members is in a relationship. She is 34 years old and has three children. Benecia has a restaurant, where she prepares different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups and meat stews. She works from 08:00 am until 05:00 pm and has been doing it for ten years. She is doing very well and her dream is to expand her business.

Benecia is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to cook, such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo asked permission to have their pictures taken after the meeting for work-related reasons.

Some of the remaining members work selling pigs and other animals, while the others have a grocery store or a restaurant.

Benecia wants to thank those who share her dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La Joven Karla tiene 24 años  de edad, es madre de  dos  hijos, vive con su compañero de hogar, es una persona que con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante, sale desde muy tempranas horas a su negocio dándole una atención de primera a sus clientes lo que la caracteriza es su amabilidad.
Karla su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar cuenta con más de 2 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad y está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, arroz, manteca, harina, huevos, etc. y espera que esto le contribuya a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Karla su sueño es darle una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.


 Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Karla is 24 years old, she has three children and lives with her partner. She is very determined to get ahead. She goes to work very early in the mornings to attend to her customers, and she is characterized by her kindness.

Karla works selling staple goods. She has worked in this business for more than two years, and she asks for a loan to buy beans, sugar, rice, butter, flour, eggs, etc. She hopes that by this she will have more items on stock in her shop, and thus be able to increase her income to cover the household expenses and financial liabilities.

Karla's dream is to offer her children a good education, and to improve the living conditions of her family.

Trojes, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, butter, flour, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, actualmente vive con su familia integrada por su esposa y sus hijos; siendo un niño fue aprendiendo todo lo relacionado con la agricultura y la pesca, hoy en día realiza estas actividades como una fuente de ingresos para subsistir con su familia, siendo su potencial la comercialización de mariscos, dos de sus hijos mayores le ayudan a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en la reparación del motor y en hacer mejoras a la lancha, permitiéndole tener un mejor desplazamiento en la playa y llegar a lugares en donde pueda pescar mayor cantidad de  mariscos, espera tener mejores ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Don José tiene como proyectos cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, mantenerse trabajando y cancelar su deuda con buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
José currently lives with his family, which consists of his wife and his children. When he was a child, he learnt everything related to agriculture and fishing, and today those activities are his source of income in order to provide for his family. He sells seafood. His two oldest children help him to cover the household expenses.

He asks for a loan to pay for the repair of his motor, and to make improvements to his boat. By this, he can better move around near the shore and get to places where he can catch more seafood. By this he expects to improve his income and to be able to fulfill all his obligations.

It is José's plan to provide for the basic needs of his family, to continue his work and to repay his debt with a good credit record.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the motor, and to make improvements to the boat, so that he can better move around near the shore.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joel, 44, who is married and has four children. He practices dairy farming. He is borrowing money to buy quality fodder for his two cows to help increase their milk production in order to meet the growing milk demand in his locality. He looks forward to a steady income that will allow him to pay for his children's studying materials and tuition fees.

He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for fodder.

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Minh is a Kinh person who followed her husband to Son La province to work in 2001. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La.

Her main job is as a teacher at a school in Mai Son district. Currently, she and her husband are looking to raise pigs and chickens in the garden, but they don’t have enough money. Therefore, she really wants a loan to invest in this breeding model to get more income and improve her family’s living conditions.

She believes that with this loan she and her husband will work industriously to develop the breeding model to earn money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.  She hopes her family will have a more stable life, and that her son will have everything he needs as he grows up.

loans.use: to breed pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовала его по назначению и очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, профинансировавшим ее. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Рыскул есть 5 коров, 13 овец, 4 лошади, 2 теленка и 16 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья скота, а также в постройку дома для сына.
texts.en: Ryskul successfully repaid her previous loan, having used it for the intended purpose. She is very grateful to Kiva and all of the investors who financed it. She now has 5 cows, 13 sheep, 4 horses, 2 calves, and 16 goats. In order to continue developing her business Ryskul has asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. She plans to use the income from the loan to continue investing in livestock and to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Quang Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quang Thi Xuan is a Thai ethnic person; now she lives with her family in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family consists of her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).   

Because of her family’s difficult circumstances, her son had to leave school to help his parents; her daughter is attending at Mai Son secondary school in Son La.

Sources of her family’s income are mainly from crops and livestock. But this year due to unfavorable weather, income from her family's cultivation is not worth it. Her daughter is at school age, so  Mrs. Quang Thi Xuan wants to borrow an additional amount to cover tuition costs for her child. She and her husband will work hard to repay for M7-MFI on time.

She hopes that with this loan from M7- MFI, her daughter will have good conditions for education that will bring her a brighter future.

loans.use: to cover tuition costs for children

loans.name: Tunu Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her mid-20s, is single.  She has been running  a beauty salon and a genge duka (little shop) for four years now.  She works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.
  
This will be Rose’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to open the beauty  salon and increased the genge duka stock.  She is doing great and happy with the loans.  She and her group appreciate Kiva for their support.   She has paid back both her loans successfully.  She  used the profit to increase the genge duka  stock and  bought salon products.  She will use this loan to open new business of making and selling bites (snacks) in hotels.   She dreams of going back to her profession as a designer. 
 
Rose will share this loan with her loan group "Tunu” which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new business of making and selling bites (snacks) in hotels.

loans.name: Lo Tien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien has been a member of M7-MFI since 2008. She is now 27 years old and lives with her husband and her two little children in Mai Son district, Son La province. The two little children are attending primary school. 

Tien’s family lives mainly by farming and animal husbandry, with their main plant being coffee. Each year, Mrs. Tien uses the profits from their coffee harvest to cover the family’s expenses, and the remainder is used to invest in expanding the area of cultivation and buy fertilizer. This year, her family has expanded by two hectares. With this large planting area, she doesn’t have enough money to invest, so she wants to borrow a loan from M7-MFI to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize plants in the garden.

She hopes with the supportive loan from M7-MFI, coffee trees in the garden will have higher productivity in this year as compared with these past years. She and her husband will work hard to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time. Hopefully, her family economy will be stable in the future and her children will have good conditions for studying.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for plants

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mathew, 26 years of age, very young, hardworking and energetic. He hails from the Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and weather patterns that favor farming. Mathew is blessed with one adorable child and has been doing farming for the past three years. 

Mathew was raised in a humble family, and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of lack of tuition fees. As a result of this, he never got any formal employment and didn’t settle down to that. He started farming, and through farming he has been able to take care of his family and also take care of his parents. Mathew's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg-selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. 

The Nandi hills area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Mathew is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Mathew is very determined to succeed and because he is much disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents.

Mathew's dream is to go back to school and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to bring his produce to market

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en:
Zoia is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Terjola district. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard with 800 grape vines. Zoia and her husband work hard and they produce wine to sell locally with the harvested grapes. Besides this, they have two cows and and produce dairy products, to sell as well as for family use.

 Zoia owns a plot of agricultural land where she decided to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2500 Gel. With the received credit she will purchase all the needed materials to build a greenhouse and when the greenhouse is built, she will purchase seeds and will grow greens there. This will increase their income. Zoia awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow greens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a tailoring shop and has been in this business for 14 years now. She is 35 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with three children. She also supports four members of her family. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She will use this loan to buy more fabric materials, thread and clothes laces for use in her tailoring business. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of fabric materials.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to open a wholesale shop for selling tailoring materials and have a better life with her family.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials for use in her business.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is forty-nine years old, married with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. Amon has been operating a retail shop selling general merchandise for fourteen years now. He has managed to look after his family and build rentals to improve on his income. 

Amon began the business to get daily income and he has a dream of expanding his business, however, limited capital is a challenge. Amon wants money to buy rice, sugar, soap and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soap and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en: Didas is an old client to the institution. He is married with six children; four attend school. He does coffee trade as his major source of income; it is the major economic activity in his area. He he has done it for over 15 years and has clients from across the country. His major challenge was limited capital, which used to affect his operations. To overcome such a challenge, he came to Ugafode for financial assistance to boost the business. Using the loan, Didas expanded his business and is able to meet his financial needs such as paying tuition for his children. He applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy more coffee and increase his profitability. Didas thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance that has enabled him to educate his children and meet all his financial obligations.

loans.use: To buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Kan Group

texts.en:
Kan is a 54-year-old widowed woman with a daughter living in Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has a grocery stall, and she has been in this business since 2012, earning $6 daily. 

Now Kan would like to request a loan as a group of three members. She will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will provide her with hygienic living conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with three children. He has a grocery business, which he has been running for seven years now. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, vegetables, and fruits to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the basic needs of his family.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, aged 30 years, is a resident of Koibatek, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. He owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than six years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Daniel passionately loves dairy farming; as he likes to put it, “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. 

The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a thirty-two-year-old married man who runs a stationery shop in Hoima, Uganda. In his business he deals mainly in buying and selling books, pens, reams of paper and other scholastic materials. 

Alex hopes to expand his business and become self-reliant, but competition hinders his business. He is acquiring the loan facility to buy more books and reams of papers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more books and reams of papers to sell

loans.name: Hoang Minh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi Minh was born in 1973 and currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her elder son has just passed his examination to get into Son La College, and the second son is studying at Mai Son senior high school. 

Due to her difficult circumstances, she wasn't fortunate enough to go to school when she was at school age. Thoroughly understanding the disadvantages and the hardship of being illiterate, Minh wants her children to have a complete education in the future, not be disadvantaged as her was, so she tries to work hard to have money to cover her children’s education costs. But the new school year is coming, which means there are more expenses needed such as education fees, school supplies, etc. With her family’s income, this amount is still very difficult.

Knowing the saving and credit program of M7-MFI, she hopes M7-MFI will support her to borrow a loan. She and her husband will work hard to repay the loan on time. She is hoping that with this loan, her children can have better conditions for their education in order to have a brighter future and become useful citizens of their society.

loans.use: to cover children’s education costs

loans.name: Mugumoini Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jane, forty-one years old and blessed with three children. She lives with her husband. She is a dairy farmer; part of the milk produced is put to domestic use while the rest is for commercial purposes. 

Jane has applied for loan to buy a tank for water storage. This will ensure the animals get clean water free from any contamination thus safeguarding their health. She hopes this will ensure she maintains a consistent supply of milk hence a stable income. Jane plans to use profits in catering for family needs such as food and clothing. 

 She is  happy for Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Bidii B Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Leah. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013.

She operates a kiosk. She is borrowing money to purchase more stock of flour, sugar and other household items. Leah is happy for the entrepreneurial training she received from HiH EA, which has helped her gain knowledge and skills in business management. 

She hopes her business will thrive, and hence, cause a rise in income level. This will enable her to cater for her family needs such as school fees.

Leah is happy for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, sugar and household items.

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Maida, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children:  two girls and one son, and all of them are still in school.  She has been selling spare parts  (mixed) for four years now.  She works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.
  
This will be a part of her many years' loans from  Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock her shop with out of stock items and also to keep on  buying the fast moving items in her shop.    She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.   She is really happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support.   She  will use this loan to buy new and up to date spares in her shop.  She dreams of building her house, being a single parent who sends  her kids to good schools, and also improving her business.

Maida will share this loan with her loan group “Nissan” which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new and up-to-date spares for her shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a young farmer from Chebiemit, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. 

She is a mother of four children who has been doing farming for the last five years so that she can supplement her income from the salary she gets. Sarah does crop farming and cattle keeping, and she enjoys farming a lot. 

Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and diseases. This has made her seek a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a sheep. With this sheep, her projections are that by the end of the year, the sheep will have given birth to at least four other sheep. Through sheep keeping, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will be increasing her income level. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is named Zipporah, who describes herself as ambitious. She is forty-eight years old, married and has seven children.

After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she received training in business development, which enabled her to manage her fruit farming business effectively. She is borrowing a loan to purchase a water tank to store water for irrigation. She hopes this will help counter her biggest challenge of lack of farming water. This will lead to improved crop yield; hence, she will be in a position to supply more fruits. 

She looks forward to increased income, thus improving her family’s standard of living by educating their children and providing them with food.

Zipporah appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and Kiva for the support, and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for irrigation.

loans.name: Zakary

texts.en:
This is Zachary, twenty-three years old and single.  He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 where he gained knowledge on savings mobilization and Enterprise development which enabled him to run his business effectively. He applied for a first loan which helped him to start maize, beans and potato farming.

Zachary is now borrowing money to expand this business by purchasing farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide and storage sacks. This will go a great way toward increasing his income. He plans to plough back the profits in order to realize his dream of having a stable business.

 Zachary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pestcides and storage sacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and lives in the town of Natete B in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, with 4 of them currently in school.

For the past 3 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail business, which sells charcoal. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits, to pay school fees for her children, and to have a healthy life with her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start making the charcoal and transporting it on her own. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elzat

texts.ru: Эльзат 35 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Эльзат высшее образование, она работает в школе учительницей кыргызского языка. Также с 1993 года начала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 10,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Эльзат есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 бычок, 10 овец. Также у Эльзат есть земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль и яблони для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Накопленные средства Эльзат старается вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса, однако в этом году она решила отремонтировать свой дом.  Поэтому Эльзат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), она купит материалы для ремонта пола. Ремонт Эльзат с супругом делают сами, экономя на оплате строителям. Доходы от бизнеса позволят Эльзат расширять ее бизнес и накопить средства на образование детей.
texts.en: Elzat is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three. Elzat has a college degree and works in a secondary school teaching Kyrgyz language. Also, since 1993 she has been engaged in farming. She had only 10,000 as her starting capital. At present Elzat’s farm includes two cows, two calves, one bull, and 10 sheep. Also Elzat has a 2.0 ha [5 acres] land plot, where she grows beans and apples for own consumption and sale. Elzat makes an effort to use her savings to  invest in business development. However, this year she decided to renovate her house. This is why Elzat has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS; she will buy supplies to renovate her floor. Elzat and her husband do the renovations themselves in order to save on the contractors’ fees. The revenue from her farm will allow Elzat to keep expanding her business and save up for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing of her floor.

loans.name: Lo Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lo Thi Huong was born in 1977. She has two children and the eldest child is married and lives separately from the rest of the family. The second child is attending senior high school. She and her family live in Mai Son district, Son La Province.

She joined the program in 1999. She is one of the active members with the spirit of helping and sharing difficulties with other members in the Group/Cluster. Her family lives by growing rice, and the rice harvested is just enough to eat. After harvest season, she often goes to work for other people to get more income to cover her family’s expenses.

She intends to fix the kitchen this year and replace the sugarcane leaf roof with a tile roof to prevent fires and to avoid it overturning during the rainy season. Over the years, she has accumulated some savings, but not enough. She needs to borrow additional funds from the M7-MFI to buy materials to fix her kitchen.

Mrs. Huong has a simple dream: “Hoping that she does not have to worry when the dry season and the rainy season comes.” With the loan borrowed from M7-MFI together with her savings, her dreams will come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix her kitchen.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun is a 31-year-old garment factory worker with two children, from Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2010. Both of her children attend school. Her husband is 35 years old, a motorcycle taxi driver. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now Roeun would like to request a loan to buy a cow for rice farming and breeding. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for rice farming and breeding

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 43 years old and married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 8 children. He sells cereals as well as livestock and has been in this business for 10 years. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of cereals and livestock to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to service the loan. 

This is Simon's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to grow his business and be a successful businessman. He wants to make more profit and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals and livestock to sell.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan es de la ciudad de San Pedro, es una persona que quiere salir adelante por medio de su profesión, es por ello que se esta esforzando bastante.
Esta siguiendo la carrera de administración agraria y  cuando termine sus estudios quiere ejercer su profesión y  tener su propia empresa.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de su matrícula y de su cuota, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Hernan is from the city of San Pedro. He is a person who wants to get ahead through his profession so he is exerting himself a lot. He is studying Agricultural Management and when he finished his studies he wants to work in his profession and have his own company. He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition and fees. In this way he can continue his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with four kids, all of whom are grown up
.
Sauda has been running a rental house business for the past ten years. Her main customers are people at checkpoints, and her biggest challenge is seasonality. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 shillings (KES) to purchase equipment for the renovation and repainting of the houses. She decided to take out a loan from Yehu to be able to meet these expenses.

Her dream is to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the renovation and repainting of the houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Chance

texts.en:
Chance is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nateete B in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Chance has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Chance has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes for sale. It will help Chance to generate greater profits, improve her business and also be able to take care of her child. 

Chance hopes that in the future she will be able to own a much bigger boutique. 

Chance is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Chance who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kunthim

texts.en:
Kunthim is a 27-year-old homemaker with two children living in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. One of her children is a student. Her husband is a driver, transporting garment-factory workers for monthly fees. He has been in this work since 2011, earning $13 a day. 

Now Kunthim would like to request a loan to buy calves to fatten and then resell. This loan will help her earn more income. 

In the future, she wants to buy a bigger Korean truck for her husband to transport garment-factory workers, build a new house and help her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten and then resell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a lovely lady from rural Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for 12 years to take care of her four children. Her main income is from milk and crops grown on her farm. She stated that she loves what she does because it is sustainable for the environment and profitable as well. However, lack of funds is her biggest challenge.
 
Cecilia is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter. She has plans of expanding her dairy farm by growing her milk production volume. A chaff cutter is going to help her achieve the objective by shredding fodder into little evenly cut pieces that the stock can quickly and easily ingest and digest. Feed in this form is also easily mixable to come up with a ration good for the stock.

With your lending, Cecilia's stock will grow healthy and productive. This will boost the amount of milk she takes to the market. Returns from the investment will enable her to repay the debt and afford education fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a good-quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 29 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with two children. He sells clothes and has been in this business for 10 years, now.

He will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. These include jeans, trousers, sweaters, and shirts. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and also service his loan.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to grow his business and be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha sells clothes in Nakuru town and has been in this business for 10 years now. She is 56 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes such as skirts and blouses to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

This is her first loan term form VisionFund Kenya and she hopes to be successful and have a good future with her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is a 36-year-old garment factory worker. She is a married woman and has five children, and they live in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been a factory worker since 2008. Two of her children are also factory workers, and the other three attend school. Her husband is a 33-year-old motorcycle taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $21 a day.

Now Phalla would like to request a loan, which she will use to buy lumber to build a house. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions.

In the future, she wants to buy a Korean truck, for her husband to use for transporting garment-factory workers for fees. In addition, she wants to help her children to pursue higher education.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Abadaharirana Group

texts.en:
Abadaharirana is a group led by Vestine, who is 26 years old. The group name means “non solidarity” in English. She has been a group leader for four years. 

She sells food and has been selling in a business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Isaiah. He is a hardworking 60-year-old farmer based in Nganga village in Central Kenya. Isaiah has four children. 

He has been doing mixed farming for 15 good years. He keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows crops on his farm. He also holds a salary-paying job besides other side hustles to complement farming.

Isaiah is determined to keep growing his mixed farm. He is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow that will widen his asset base and provide additional milk for sale. He plans to use the returns from this investment to repay the loan. The income he makes will also enable him to pay for his children's education. 

When asked how his family will benefit from the loan, Isaiah replied, "They will enjoy all the benefits that come with increase in family income."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a married woman; she has two kids, one of whom attends school. Siti owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

Siti has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door, where passersby and town dwellers are her potential passengers. She faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy seasons when it becomes difficult to operate the business.

She wants to use the KES 50,000 loan, together with money she has saved, to purchase a new motorcycle. Siti joined Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 42 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 8 children. He does livestock trading and has been in this business for 8 years now. It has been profitable.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy more goats and sheep to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be successful and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Argentina Dolores

texts.es:
Un ambiente tranquilo y productos ordenados y de excelente calidad es lo que reciben todos los clientes al entrar a la pequeña pulpería de Argentina, una señora que a sus 54 años sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Hace ocho años estableció su negocio con el objetivo de ser una mujer emprendedora en busca de un futuro seguro y estable. Está casada y tiene seis hijos, todos mayores e independientes, quienes día a día le apoyan para salir adelante.
Con ánimos de seguir prosperando, Argentina solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos como arroz y frijoles; también aceite,  refrescos, gaseosas, productos lácteos, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Estima que el financiamiento mejorara su condición de vida puesto que logrará cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo logrará aumentar sus ingresos. Entres sus planes futuros, planea seguir trabajando y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Upon entering Argentina’s small grocery store, customers are greeted with a calm and orderly atmosphere, and excellent quality products. Argentina is 54 years old, and continues to work with all of her efforts and dedication. Eight years ago she established her business in order to be an entrepreneurial woman with a safe and stable future. She is married and has six children, all of whom are grown up and independent, who help her succeed every day.
 
With the aim of continuing to prosper, Argentina is requesting a loan to increase her production capital, which she needs to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, along with oil, drinks, soft drinks, dairy products, and cleaning products, among others. She hopes that the loan will improve her living conditions, and will allow her to meet customer demand while increasing her income. Among her future plans, she plans to keep working and keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, along with oil, drinks, soft drinks, dairy products, and cleaning products, among others.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Hellen dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 39 years old and a married woman, from the village Grakali, in Kaspi district. She has a husband, two kindergarten-aged children, and a mother-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Maia's husband is a private artisan and earns 200 GEL monthly.

In spite of her high education, Maia was unable to find any stable job, so she engaged in poultry business. She has several chickens. She sells chickens, after growing enough, at a good price. Now Maia wants to expand her agribusiness and start dairy farming. She requested a loan from Credo. Credo and Kiva have a joint initiative, which gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. So, Maia plans to purchase a milk-cow and start selling dairy products, locally. This will give her a chance to increase her income and more effectively tackle the family's financial difficulties. Maia and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders, and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and start selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Farming, also called agriculture or husbandry, is the cultivation of animals and plants for food and other products used to sustain life. Agriculture continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product. Robinson, 42, started farming approximately 11 years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land, located in the Thika area of Kenya, houses poultry and dairy cows.

Robinson passionately loves dairy farming. The Thika area is populated, and has a ready market for dairy products. However, Robinson's biggest challenge is feeding his cows, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces, before it is mixed with other kinds of forage. This helps the animal's digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. Through this loan, Robinson will double his milk production.

Robinson has been facing challenges accessing financing, but he feels relieved, knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva are there, to make his dream come true. Robinson chose Juhudi Kilimo, because the interest rate on their loans is low, and is on a reducing basis. Robinson underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Robinson's income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, están en su primer ciclo, son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por poder salir adelante, quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Beatriz es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es la presidenta del grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que está luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de tortas que hace sobre pedido y que a sus clientes gusta mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, azúcar, manteca, huevos y demás, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus tortas y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are 18 members of this communal banking group.  They are in their first loan cycle. All the women are heads of their households and are struggling to get ahead.  They want to give their families everything that they could not have. 

Beatriz is one of the members of this group.  She is the President of the communal bank. She is a hard-working woman and entrepreneurial.  She is struggling to grow and get ahead.  She works selling cakes that she makes based on orders and her clients like them very much.  She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter, eggs and other items, so that she can continue making her cakes and meeting the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs and other items for making cakes.

loans.name: Hardman

texts.en:
Hardman is thirty-six years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Hardman operates a bar and owns rental houses. He has been in that business since 2000. He began the business to have a day-to-day income and take care of his family.

Hardman is a hard-working person with a dream of completing his house. However, he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Hardman wants money to buy beers, sodas, water, and spirits, for selling.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell, including beers, sodas, water, and spirits

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 46 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with four children. He has a barber shop, which he has been running for 10 years. Besides the barber shop as his primary activity, Daniel also sells livestock.

This is Daniel's first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use this loan to buy shaving machines. He will also use the loan to buy more livestock to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to build a house for his family. His hopes for the future are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine and livestock to sell.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Las Poderosas es un grupo que está esforzándose por poder salir adelante, están en su 2do. Ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, además de ello están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana, quien es niñera, pero como medio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida está vendiendo comestibles que es asadito, y por medio de ello puede ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para la elaboración de sus asaditos, carne, pancitos, condimentos, etc. También se le ha dado varias capacitaciones de negocio lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Las Poderosas is a group that is providing strong support for each other in their efforts to get ahead. They are in their second loan cycle in the Women's Program. They are also part of the elimination of poverty research survey which will allow them to continue growing their businesses.

One of the group members is Sra. Rossana who earns her living babysitting. However, in order to improve her standard of living, she also sells food so she can help support her family and loved ones. She is seeking a loan to buy meat, bread buns, spices etc. for the dishes she makes. Rossana has also taken part in the business training programs that will help her increase income.

loans.use: Buy meat, bread buns, spices etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a smallholder farmer based at Bomonyara village in the Kisii region of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane region. John has been farming for six years, but the income he makes from it is not enough to take care of his six children. John was forced to venture into other, side businesses, to make extra income.

Today, John is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce enough milk for his family's consumption and extra for sale. The income he gets from selling milk will go, first, toward repaying the loan. The income left will be used to develop his farm and make it more productive.

John aspires to be a full-time farmer. Your loan will help him to buy more assets and make more income from farming. Once he grows his agribusiness through ploughing back profits, he will be able to sustain his family's lifestyle purely off farming. John stated that his family's living standard will be improved through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Josinta

texts.en: Josinta is 28 years old and married with three children. They live in Kasese, Uganda. Josinta started a retail shop to help her husband with some family expenditures. Josinta is a hardworking woman with a dream of educating her children. However, inadequate capital is still a challenge. Josinta wants money to buy sugar, cassava flour, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cassava flour, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty-two-year-old man, who is married and has seven children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His business is cocoa buying and selling, but he also has cocoa gardens. He is a very hard-working man, and he hopes to educate his children. He started his business in 2007 and is steadily moving on well. His challenge is inadequate capital. He wants the loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to resell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet John. He is a 39-year-old farmer from Chebiemit village, situated in Kapsowar area of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and four children, on a small piece of land where he keeps poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For five years, his primary sources of income have been eggs and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases.

John made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo, in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan for expanding his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations, to increase the overall output.

The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working, to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, John’s children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand horticulture farming

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado en la escuela de la comunidad donde él vive desde que nació, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen una hija recién nacida.    

Carlos trabaja de ayudante de albañil desde hace 5 años y viaja en bus a distintos municipios, antes de tomar el bus camina 20 minutos y para ello se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, su pareja se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno, además Carlos cultiva maíz y frijol para el consumo del hogar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar 4 sacos de abono para aplicar al cultivo de maíz, y para pagar un dinero que le prestaron para el parto de su esposa.

Él tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando para darle a su bebé recién nacida todo lo que sea necesario porque es una gran bendición que dios le ha dado.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old and has a grade 6 education from the school in the community where he has lived since he was born. He is married and his wife looks after the home and their recently born daughter.

Carlos has worked as an assistant bricklayer for five years. He travels by bus to different places to work. Before catching the bus, he has to walk for 20 minutes, so he gets up at 4 am. His wife gets up at 3 am to prepare his breakfast. Carlos also grows maize and beans for his family to eat.

He needs a loan to buy four bags of manure for his maize crop and to pay back the money he borrowed for his wife's confinement. He has a great desire to continue his work so he can give his new baby daughter all that she needs because God has blessed them greatly with her birth.

loans.use: Buy four bags of manure for his maize crop

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a farmer, based in Nandi Hills in the Great Rift Valley Province of Kenya. He inherited a four-acre piece of land, which he uses to keep dairy cattle and poultry, and to grow crops. The money he makes from selling crops, milk, and eggs has enabled him to take care of his three children. He also engages in other, side businesses, to make additional income.

He enjoys farming because of the countless opportunities in this sector. However, his biggest challenge is that the local market is glutted with the kinds of produce he is offering. It is for this reason that Abraham is seeking a loan to purchase a motorbike. With your loan, the motorcycle will help him to transport his produce to a farther market, where there is higher demand and the prices are fair.

The money he makes from improving his profit margin will help him to deal with the surging family expenses. His life and the way he carries out business will be changed, with the acquisition of the motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, which will enable him to reach markets where he can get higher prices for his produce

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 28 years old and a single mother of three children. She has a food stall in Nakuru town.

She will be using this loan to buy food stock, to sell at her business. These include potatoes, cereals, vegetables, mangoes, and bananas. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and service her loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In future, she hopes to be successful in her business, to earn more income, and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy foods to sell at her stall, including fruits, vegetables, and cereals

loans.name: Erika Yasmin

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 27 años de edad que instalo en su casa un corral para criar cerdos buscando tener una micro-empresa para generar recursos y aportar en su casa que tanto escasean. 
Tiene dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad y aprendió de su profesión porque nació en una familia campesina donde adquirió empíricamente estas actividades. 
Buscando ser más competitiva en el sector y dar buenos precios Erika quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos cerdos y cuido para alimentarlos haciendo de sus cerdos animales de gran calidad para los posibles compradores.
Erika es ambiciosa y sueña con tener su propia casa y no se detendrá hasta conseguirla pues quiere vivir en ella junto a su familia.
texts.en:
27-year old Erika has built a pig pen in her yard where she can raise pigs in her search for a business that will generate income to help her improve her home which lacks so much. She has two children aged 10 and 13. She was born into a family of farmers so learned all about farming as she grew up.

As she wishes to become more competitive and give fair prices, Erika is seeking a loan to buy two pigs, care, and speciality food for them. Then she will have quality animals to sell to prospective buyers.

Erika is ambitious and her dream is to have a home of her own. She is wasting no time in obtaining one where she can live with her family.

loans.use: Buy two pigs, care, and specialized food

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru: Райкан 57 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. Райкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес в 1989 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Райкан на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 1 теленок, 2 бычка и 20 овец, также на земельном наделе мерою 1,62 Га она выращивает клевер для заготовки корма для скота на зиму. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Райкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Райкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует купить породистых дойных коров для увеличения объемов продаж молока.
texts.en: Raikan is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of two. Raikan is raising animals and growing farm produce, having launched this business in 1989. Thanks to Raikan’s hard work, her farm now includes three cows, one calf, two bulls and 20 sheep. Also, on her land plot of 1.62 ha [4 acres] she grows clover in order to have animal feed in winter. In order to develop her business further, Raikan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS to buy cattle for fattening and resale. Raikan plans to invest her revenues into a further expansion of her farm. She also plans to buy purebred dairy cows to increase milk sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business development.

loans.name: Ngomuchech Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Ngomuchech Women Group. She is fifty-one years old, married, and has been blessed with four children.

Mary practices dairy farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. As a result, she gained skills of savings mobilization, group records, and business development. This enabled her to mobilize some savings through piggy bank, and she used the money to purchase a dairy cow. She is borrowing a loan to purchase another cow, so as to double the milk production and thereby improve her income. She plans to plough back part of the anticipated income into her business, so that she will maintain a stable, dairy farming business. Mary is grateful for the Kiva support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase a second cow.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, age 34, lives in Kapsowar, which is a small agricultural center in the Rift Valley area of Kenya. He is a husband and a father of four, lovely children. 

Jacob started a mixed farm in 2005 and he continues to farm for a living. His primary income sources are eggs, tea, and crops. Jacob enjoys poultry farming and dairy farming, above all other activities. The main challenges he faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed. 

Jacob is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats. To him, raising goats is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience. He understands the challenges and the market uncertainties that come with goat farming. This knowledge has influenced his strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand. 

Jacob plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for his children’s education. When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said, “I will be able to educate my children and also feed my family.”

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Eugenio Prudencio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 61 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, está acompañado y tiene 6 hijos, 3 de ellos viven aparte, 2 estudian y el último no porque aún no tiene la edad, por lo tanto solo 3 hijos y su pareja dependen de Eugenio. 

Eugenio trabaja de albañil desde hace 20 años, este oficio lo aprendió de un tío que era albañil, también realiza el trabajo de motorista para no quedarse sin ingresos económicos,  realiza también trabajo agrícola, él trabaja todos los días de 6:00 AM a 6:00 PM.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar tres cerdos de engorde y comprará alimentación para los mismos, también comprará abono para sus cultivos.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos ser profesionales, personas de bien y que aprendan a valorar la vida.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 61 years old. He studied through sixth grade. He is in a relationship and has 6 children. Three of them live apart from them and two are in school. The last one is not because he is not yet old enough. Therefore only 3 children and his partner depend on Eugenio.

Eugenio has worked in construction for 20 years. He learned this trade from an uncle who was also a construction worker. He also does work as a driver so as to not be left without an income. He does work in agriculture as well. He works every day from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

He needs the loan to purchase three fattening pigs and feed for them. He will also buy fertilizer for his crops.

His dream is to see his children become professionals and good people who value life.

loans.use: to purchase three fattening pigs and feed for them. He will also buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Shahobjon

texts.ru:
Шахобчон молодой студент в возрасте 18 лет. Он учится во втором курсе Таджикского Национального Университета в учетно-экономическом факультете. Шахобчон пошел по стопам своего отца. Его отец является бухгалтером и работает в этой профессии уже несколько лет. А мать Шахобчона домохозяйка. У Шахобчона есть еще один брат и сестренка. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Варзоб.
Шахобчон сейчас нуждается в кредите. Он хочет оплатить за свой учебный год в ВУЗе. Шахобчон просит Вас помочь ему. Он хочет успешно окончить университет и в будущем стать квалифицированным специалистом как его отец.
texts.en:
Shahobjon is a young college student, aged 18. He is in his second year at the Tajik National University in the accounting and economics department. Shahobjon followed in his father's footsteps. His father is an accountant and has been working in this profession for several years. And Shahobjon's mother is a homemaker. Shahobjon has another brother and a little sister. He and his family lives in the Varzob region.

Shahobjon now needs a loan. He wants to pay for his school year at the university. Shahobjon is requesting help. He wants to successfully complete college and in the future to become a qualified specialist like his father.

loans.use: to pay for his school year

loans.name: Familia Mina Vieja Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Familia Mina Vieja” se encuentra ubicada en una comunidad caracterizada por los árboles enormes y frondosos. Además, tampoco se celebran fiestas patronales ya que la mayoría de las personas practica la religión evangélica. 

El grupo está conformado por Doña Catalina y Marciano quienes son esposos y padres de cinco hijos, de los cuales, tres de ellos también son miembros del grupo de préstamo: Carlos, Marcial y Óscar quienes ya son padres de familia. Los otros dos hijos de Catalina aún dependen de ella aunque sólo la más pequeña sigue estudiando. 

Óscar platica que al ver el problema económico en el que se encontraba su familia, hace años él y sus dos hermanos decidieron emigrar a los Estados Unidos para trabajar y ayudar a sus padres. Con el dinero que enviaban a México, don marciano ahorró hasta comprar un taxi y y ofrecer este servicio. Óscar comenta que la experiencia en el extranjero no era lo que esperaban sus hermanos y él así que regresaron a su comunidad donde iniciaron a trabajar como choferes para otra persona. Aunque no había muchas ganancias, con sus ingrsos y lo que habían ahorrado en su estancia en el país vecino pudieron comprar carros usados para dejar de ser empleados y tener su propio negocio de taxis.

Óscar es muy alegre y bromeando comentó “tenemos nuestros taxis finamente 'fiaditos' (a crédito) pero ahora ya no trabajamos para nadie más y para eso requerimos el préstamo, para terminar de pagarlos". Óscar explica que los días lunes, un autobús que pasa por la misma ruta les quita todo el pasaje y que las carreteras en mal estado los orilla a llevar los taxis al mecánico con más frecuencia. Sin embargo, su padre, sus hermanos y él trabajan todos los días muy contentos para lograr sus metas de tener más autos y dar empleo a otros choferes.

Muy sonriente Doña Catalina comentó “VisionFund nos ha cambiado la vida”, la familia aún no termina de pagar algunos de sus automóviles pero el crédito les permite adelantar sus pagos. "Mi esposo incluso pudo comprarse un taxi del año 2015 con uno de los créditos" comenta feliz Catalina quien a diferencia de su marido y de sus hijos, se dedica a criar animales como pollos, vacas, borregos y pavos. con las ganancias de esta actividad, Catalina comenzó a comprar algunos abarrotes y abrió una pequeña tienda.
