Los dos últimos préstamos los ocupó para comprar un molino nuevo (que renta a gente de su comunidad) y para ampliar la tienda. Esta vez invertirá su préstamo en más productos de abarrotes.

La familia está muy agradecida con VisionFund México porque gracias a los préstamos que han obtenido ya durante dos años han podido salir adelante, platican que anteriormente estaban trabajando con otra microfinanciera pero en un viaje al municipio vieron algunos anuncios, pidieron informes y les encantó la idea de formar un grupo de familia además de la baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
The “Familia Mina Vieja” communal bank is located in a community known for it's enormous leafy trees. Also as the majority of people are Protestants they don' t celebrate their Saint's Day festivals.

The group is made up of Catalina and Marciano who are husband and wife and parents to 5 children. Three of the children are also members of the group: Carlos, Marcial and Óscar as they are now fathers of families. Catalina's other two children still are dependent on her although only the youngest still studies.

Óscar says that given the economic problems of the family, years ago he and his two brothers emigrated to the United States to work and help their parents. With the money they sent to Mexico Marciano saved and bought a taxi and worked offering it's services. Óscar comments that their experience abroad wasn't what the brothers expected so they returned to their community to work as drivers for other people. Although there was not much profit, with his income and the money that he saved in his time in the neighboring country he could buy used cars to stop being employees and have their own taxi business.

Óscar is very cheerful and jokes commenting “ we have our taxis extremely financed but now we don't have to work for somebody and so we need the loan to finish paying for them”. Óscar explains that on Mondays a bus travels the same route taking away all their passengers and that the pavement on the road is in bad shape so they have to take the cars to the mechanic more often. However he his father and brothers work very happily every day to achieve their goal of having more taxis and provide employment for other drivers.

With a smile Catalina comments that “ Vision Fund has changed our lives”. The family still hasn't finished paying for some of their automobiles but the loan allows them to move along with their payments. “ My husband was able to purchase a 2015 vehicle as a taxi with one of the loans” Catalina happily comments who unlike her husband and sons raises animals like chickens, cows, lambs and turkeys. With the profits from this activity she has started to buy some groceries and open a small store.

They used the last two loans to buy a mill which they rent out to people in the community and expand the store. This time they will invest the loan in more grocery products. The family is very grateful to VisionFund México as thanks to the loans they have obtained in the past two years they have been able to get ahead. They say that they worked with another micro-finance company but on a trip into the municipality they saw some advertisements, requested information and they were enchanted with the idea of forming a family group and with the lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to pay for taxis and buy food products.

location.town: Mina Vieja, San Flipe del Progreso

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Hello! Meet Grace, 39 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Chebiamit, a remote village in Kapsowar. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kapsowar area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood in bulk; having the raw material will allow her to continue selling her tortillas seamlessly

loans.name: Bui Uyen's Group

texts.en:
Uyen was born in 1960. She lives with her husband and her two children in the Mai Son district of Son La province. Both her children are well-behaved and have good results in their studies at school. Her son is studying at the Hanoi University of Science and Technology.


She joined the M7-MFI program in October, 2013. Despite being a new member, she always helps the other women in the group and helps them be in exemplary observance and compliance with the regulations of M7-MFI. 
	
Her only source of income is wages. Because of having to raise her two children who are now at school age, she needs to take a loan to pay for their education fees. She expects the loan will fully equip her through all conditions and will help her children to feel secure to start the new school year with a much better performance.

loans.use: to pay for education fees

loans.name: Upol

texts.ru: Упол 53 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. В 1996 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 1 бычок и 5 овец. Также на собственном земельном участке Упол выращивает картофель и зерновые культуры для потребления и реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход в том числе от пенсии составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Упол обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Упол улучшить ее благосостояние и накопить средства на воспитание и образование ее внуков.
texts.en:
Upol is 53 years old, married, and the mother of two children. In 1996, she started a business raising livestock. Currently, she has on her homestead one steer and five sheep. Upol also grows potatoes and grain crops on her own plot of land for consumption and sale. The total monthly average income including pensions amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). Upol applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep.

Income from the loan will allow Upol to improve her well-being and to save money for the upbringing and education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентина, 64 года, вдова, мать 2 сыновей. Валентина много лет проработала акушеркой в роддоме, сейчас на пенсии. С 1993 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается выращиванием и продажей комнатных в горшках и полевых цветов. Продает их по различным учреждениям. На сегодняшний день деятельность Валентины приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание двух сыновей, у которых с рождения проблемы со здоровьем. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Валентина обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку горшков и семян новых видов цветов для продажи. Доход от кредита она хочет потратить на установку санузла в доме. Доходы от кредита Валентина планирует использовать для развития своего бизнеса и улучшения благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Valentina is 64 years old, a widow, and the mother of two sons. Valentina worked for many years in a hospital as a midwife, and now she is retired.

As an additional source of income, since 1993 she has been involved in the cultivation and sale of indoor plants and wildflowers. She sells them in different establishments. Currently, Valentina's activities bring in a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS). These funds are sorely insufficient for a decent life and raising two sons who have had health problems since birth. For the further development of her business, Valentina applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS), which she will direct to the purchase of pots and seeds of new types of flowers for sale.

She wants to spend income from the loan on the installation of bathrooms in the home. Valentina plans to use income from the loan to develop her business and to improve the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase pots for house flowers and seeds in order to be more profitable and install a bathroom.

loans.name: Jafeth

texts.en:
Jafeth is 49 years old, married and with his spouse is blessed with five children. He runs a clinic and it has been profitable. 

He will use this loan to buy a water tank to use in his clinic business. This will enable him to have an adequate supply of water. He will use the anticipated profits to buy medicine for the clinic.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan has a cereals business in Nakuru town. She has been in the business for seven years now and it has been profitable. She is 28 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with two children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of cereals to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 43 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with four children. He does welding and has been in the business for 12 years. 

He will be using this loan to buy more welding materials for use in the business, such as soldering metals and spare bicycle parts. He will use the generated profits to build houses on his plot. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to be successful in his business and live a good life with his family.

loans.use: To buy welding materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 46-year-old single woman from Zugdidi district. She lives with her brother and his family and mother. Every family member gets refugee pension, because of their exile. Tina works at the local restaurant and generates approximately 300 GEL. However this income is insignificant for covering even basic needs and the family requires help for living in better condition. 

This hard-working woman decided to get additional income and start a trading business. With the loan she will purchase stock of clothing and will sell among her neighbors and employee. 

Tina has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Tina and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start a trading business in clothing and get additional income

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана — из Новой Каховки. Она работает на местном предприятии бухгалтером. Имеет также дополнительный доход от теплицы. У Светланы есть дочь, студентка. 
Сумма в 20 000 гривен понадобилась ей для того, чтобы заменить котел отопления, часть магистралей отопления, отремонтировать пол в летней кухне, установить новые окна, сделать подоконники и заменить обои. Все эти изменения в доме помогут Светлане облагородить условия жизни для нее и дочери.
texts.en:
Svetlana is from Nova Kakhovka. She works in a local enterprise as an accountant. She also has additional income from greenhouses. Svetlana has a daughter, who is a student.

A sum of 20,000 hryvnia is needed by her in order to replace a boiler, to heat the roads, to repair the kitchen floor, to install new windows, to make window sills, and to replace the wallpaper. All these changes in her home help Svetlana to improve living conditions for her and her daughter.

loans.use: to change a boiler, fix the kitchen floors, and install new windows and wallpaper in her apartment.

loans.name: Joviter

texts.en:
Joviter is 41 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two currently in school. For the past five years, Joviter has been working hard to manage her farming business. 

To help expand her business, Joviter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more manure for the soil and other items like seed. This will help Joviter generate greater profits and invest more in the bean and maize farm. Joviter hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her lifestyle. 

Joviter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joviter  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more manure for the soil and other items like seed.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Meet Nicholas, a 26-year-old smallholder Kenyan farmer who comes from Kurung village in the remote areas of Eldoret. He married a beautiful wife who has so far given him two children. Nicholas started farming five years ago. Today, he keeps poultry and dairy cattle and grows various crops. 
Nicholas stated, "I find dairy and horticultural farming to be very enjoyable! My biggest challenge is capital to expand." He is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The breed he is going for is more productive than the predominant traditional breeds. The cow will produce additional milk for sale. 
The returns he makes from this investment will go towards farm-related costs that keep piling. This cow will help his business break even sooner. His family will also enjoy a better life as a result of the increased income of their breadwinner.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Hello! Meet Priscilla, 34 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Karunge, a remote village in Thika. She is happily married and is blessed with five adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business. The Thika area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with five children and four of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She is a tailor. She has been in this business for 11 years from the market. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy material for making clothes and a new sewing machine. She does her business from home six days a week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to build a residential house. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jeison Dario

texts.es:
Jeison un joven de 24 años de edad, padre de un pequeño de 7 años del cual se enorgullece cada día más viendo su crecimiento y progreso. 
Jeison tiene hace dos años un negocio de confecciones a terceros donde cuenta con un empleado fijo y el mismo busca los clientes y se rebusca la forma de generar empleo. 
Solicita un crédito el cual empleara en la compra de una máquina sesgadora y compra de insumos como telas, agujas, hilos etc. 
Jeison tiene muy marcados sus sueños los cuales son:
•	Tener casa propia
•	Tener una empresa grande 
•	Viajar 
•	Generar muchos empleos en la zona
Su espíritu emprendedor y su gran corazón lo ayudaran a realizar sus sueños por eso pedimos ayuda a este joven para que le den alas de seguir creciendo y luchar por sus metas.
texts.en:
Jeison is a 24 year old youth. He is the father of a 7 year old child, whom he is more proud of each day watching him progress and grow. For two years Jeison has had a sewing business for third parties which has one permanent employee. He looks for clients and ways to generate employment. He is requesting a loan which he will use to buy an industrial sewing machine (sesgadora) and supplies like fabric, needles, thread etc.

Jeison have very clear dreams which are: To have his own house. To have a large business. Travel. Create a lot of employment in his area. His enterprising spirit and big heart will help him achieve his dreams. So we ask for help for this youth to give him the wings to continue to grow and strive for his goals.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine (sesgadora) and supplies like thread, fabric and needles.

loans.name: Seyilbu

texts.ru: Сейилбу, 48 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Сейилбу высшее образование, она работает в школе учителем английского языка. Также на протяжении 11 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день, благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве Сейилбу имеется 3 коровы, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Дополнительно Сейилбу занимается полеводством, на собственной земле, мерою 0,20 ГА она выращивает клевер. Клавдия хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота, за счет приобретения телят, в связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS). На доходы от кредита Сейилбу хочет и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Seyilbu is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Seyilbu has a higher education. She works in a school as an English teacher. For the last 11 years, she has also been engaged in raising livestock and crops. Thanks to her hard work and determination, Seyilbu currently has on her homestead three cows, one horse, two calves, and ten sheep. Additionally Seyilbu grows crops, on her own land, measuring 0.20 hectares. She grows clover. She wants to continue to increase the quantity of livestock, through the acquisition of calves, and in connection with this she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).

Seyilbu wants with the income from the loan to further expand her livestock count.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves in order to develop her livestock business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and blessed with five children who all attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. She sells at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a shop in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase prawns and dried fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
This is Purity. She is 40 years old, married and blessed with five children between 12 and 24 years old. 

Purity joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to be trained on entrepreneurial skills. This has helped her run her textile fabric shop more effectively. Her customer base has expanded, making her apply for a loan to buy more stock of textile fabric. This will ensure she can meet the rising demand for her goods and compete fairly in the market.  

Purity hopes her business will thrive and hence generate more income. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay her children's school fees. Purity is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy textile fabric.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane. She is 46 years old, married and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to be trained on entrepreneurial skills. This has helped her run her tailoring business more effectively. 

Jane needs a loan to buy another sewing machine. This will enable her serve customers faster, thereby maintaining a consistent and reliable service. She will also be in a position to compete fairly in this industry.  

Jane hopes her business will thrive and generate more income. She plans to use the anticipated income to cater to her family's needs, such as food, and also to expand the business. Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Risper, a 20-year-old youthful mum. She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of one child. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. 

Risper passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past two years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her parents and family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Risper has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and the price of milk has been going up recently, so Risper, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, which will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Risper said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Risper hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies for the furniture manufacturing process.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 47, is a smallholder Kenyan farmer who is based in a remote village called Kaboi. She is a mother of eigh children and takes great care of them with the help of her husband, Paul. Margaret has been doing mixed farming for 30 years!  Even still, she has been holding a day job and she is actively engaged in side businesses to make extra income for her big family. On the farm, she keeps dairy cows and poultry. She also grows tea and food crops. 
Margaret is seeking a loan to purchase poultry, maize and fertilizer. The poultry she will acquire will lay more eggs that she will sell and hatch for chicks. The maize she will acquire will restock her supply for a personal business that she is running. Finally, the fertilizer will go for the planting of her crops.
She has committed to plowing her profits back into the business to fuel growth. When asked how her family will benefit from the loan, she replied, " It will help me diversify my farm activities which, in turn, will boost the family income. This will automatically improve the standard of our living."

loans.use: to purchase poultry, maize and fertilizer

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in the small village of Ianeti with her husband, two little daughters, and mother-in-law, who gets a pension from the local government. Irma's husband works in the military and gets a fixed salary. Irma is engaged in cow breeding and in producing milk products, which she sells locally. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Irma wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of family. A loan of 2,500 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to build a greenhouse. She will harvest various kind of greens and vegetables and will sell for a good price. 

The loan will be a great support for Irma, enabling her to increase her income and make financial stability for her family. She awaits your support and will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Ha Thien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thien was born in 1980. She is an ethnic Thai person. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son District of Son La Province. She joined in the program of M7 Microfinance Institution in 2006, and she is one of the youngest members of the cluster/group. 

Her main occupation is plant cultivation and livestock breeding, so the annual income is just enough to cover minimum daily needs of her family. Her family currently needs to borrow a loan to repair the house to help her children have a cozy place to learn lessons.

She hopes the loan when borrowed can support them in having a solid house against the extreme weather of the mountainous province of Son La.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are going to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

For the past 10 years, Madina has operated a retail shop in a rented shop. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of  2,700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and beans. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations include buying a van for transporting her merchandise. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, soap, beans, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, ha invertido el crédito anterior en la tienda, permitiéndole la sostenibilidad de la misma, tiene mejores ingresos y nuevos clientes satisfechos. En su familia ha nacido una niña, el estilo de vida que hoy brinda a su familia es más confortable.
Para mantener un negocio surtido con mercadería que sus clientes demandan, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, detergentes, jabón, bebidas, etc., será de ayuda para seguir dando un buen servicio y teniendo recursos económicos.
texts.en:
José invested his previous loan in the store, which allowed him to sustain the store.  He has better income and new, satisfied customers.  A baby girl was born into his family, and the lifestyle he now provides his family with is more comfortable.

In order to keep the business stocked with the merchandise that his customers demand, he decided on a new loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and drinks, etc.  It will help him to continue giving good service and having financial resources.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and drinks, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old and single. He has no child and he supports three members of his family. He sells spare parts and has been in this business for one year now. He also has a mobile money transfer business. 

This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he will be using this loan to buy more stocks of spare parts and car engine oil to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stocks of car engine oil to sell.

John successfully paid his previous loan and his future hopes are to be successful and to be able to live a good life with his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and car engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn and wood to continue selling tortillas.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hija de 6 años de edad y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Juan es un hombre emprendedor quien  se gana la vida trabajando como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo. Dicho oficio le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Juan desea reparar el techo del corredor y parte de cocina, dado que se encuentra deteriorado y en tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra dañando sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines y clavos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 29, lives in his own house with his life partner, his six year old daughter, and his three year old son.  Juan is an enterprising man who has earned a living by working as a bricklayer for a long time.  This trade allows him to support his household and to give his family what it needs.

Juan wishes to repair the roof over the hallway and part of the kitchen.  This is because it is damaged.  During the rainy season water leaks and damages their few possessions.  In order to make the repairs, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and nails.

loans.name: Marleny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marleny, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 3 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Marleny manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Marleny is a charsimatic and cooperative woman who works in her own business; a grocery store that originated because of her need to generate income to support her family. 

Despite adversity, her willpower and determination have allowed her to move forward and it is because of this that she has been involved in this sector for over 3 years. 

Her purpose in life is to continue progressing, that is why she hopes to strengthen her business by purchasing an assortment of products, such as groceries, grains, fried snacks, sodas and basic family goods. This will allow her to offer a better quality of service to her customers; increase her sales and the revenue that she receives from her sales. 

Marleny makes it clear that her biggest desire is for her business to thrive and in the future, she wishes to have her business become a supermarket; one in which her clients will be able to find all kinds of products that they may need, thus increasing profitability and offering a better quality of life for her family.

By supporting this loan you will be contributing to the entrepreneurship of Colombia women!

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods for her business, such as groceries, grains, sodas, fried snacks, liquor and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Reinaldo Fredy

texts.es:
Reinaldo, es propietario de un taller de reparación y venta de llantas tanto para vehículo como para motocicletas, el cual fue funciona desde hace 5 años, lo atiende a tiempo completo y está ubicado en su vivienda; Reinaldo tiene 54 años de edad, su compañera de vida tiene 23 años de edad, han procreado una hija de 6 años de edad.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar llantas para vehículo y motocicletas, con esta inversión incrementara su inventario, mejorara el servicio y las ganancias, con las que costeara los gastos familiares y el pago de las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
Para Reinaldo es importante mantenerse trabajando y lograr tener un negocio más amplio con el cual genere recursos económicos para brindar a su hija educación y que en el futuro sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is the owner of a tire repair and sales workshop; a workshop for vehicle tires and motorcycle tires; this has been functioning for over 5 years. He supports this business full-time and it is located at his place of residency. Reinaldo is 54 years old, his life partner is 23 years old and they have a 6 year old daughter. 

He will use the loan to purchase vehicle and motorcycle tires, this investment will increase his inventory and improve his services and his earnings. He will be able to pay for his family’s expenses and the debt payments owed. 

For Reinaldo it is important to continue working and to broaden his business to generate economic resources to support his child’s education and so that in the future she will become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle and motorcycle tires; this investment will increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for advertising and designs to decorate her display rack

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba de 29 años de  edad, esta casada y es madre de dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad los dos van a kinder.

El esposo trabaja en la agricultura como capatas en una hacienda muy cerca de su casa,  trabaja de 5:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Ella se dedica a trabajar la agricultura desde hace 6 años, este trabajo lo aprendió cuando ella estaba pequeña sus hermanos que se dedicaban a este oficio le enseñaron como hacerlo y tiene la oportunidad de hacerlo cerca de su casa, para poder cuidar también de sus hijos, ella manifiesta que el crédito lo utilizara para comprar abono el cultivo del maíz.

Ella quiere tener la oportunidad de obtener un crédito mas grande, para poner un negocio y obtener ganancias para que en el futuro ampliar su casita, para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida con mas seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Alba is 29 years old, married, and she has two children; 4 and 5 years of age; and both of them are enrolled in kindergarten.

Her husband works in agriculture as a contractor for a hacienda close to his home, he works from 5 AM to 4 PM. 

She has been working in agriculture for over 6 years; she learned the skills from her siblings who worked in this field. Now she has the opportunity to perform it close to home, in this way she can also take care of her children, she comments that she will use the loan to purchase fertilizer to harvest corn.
 
She hopes to obtain a bigger loan so that she can establish a business and obtain profits so that she can expand her house in the future, this in order to provide a better quality of life for her children with more security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to harvest corn.

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
El señor Víctor tiene 39 años de edad,  su actividad principal  es la caficultura y venta de leña, también cuenta con su vehículo en el cual transporta pasajeros de su aldea a la Ciudad de Trojes y tiene más de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad la cual le ha permitido salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos en el hogar.
Don Víctor está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono ya que para estos tiempos fertiliza sus cultivos y asi obtendrá mejor producción, lo que le permitirá cubrir  los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros adquiridos.
Don Víctor uno de sus sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia, es una persona honrada y de trabajo es la segunda vez que está solicitando el préstamo para llevar a cabo sus proyectos y con el apoyo que reciba espera lograr sus sueños.

Trojes, Honduras Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Victor is 39 years old. His main occupation is growing coffee and selling firewood.
He also has a vehicle that he uses to transport passengers from his village to the city of Trojes. He has been doing this for over 7 years. This job allows him to move forward and improve his income. 

Victor is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, because this time of the year he has to fertilize his crops to get a better production.
This will allow him to cover the family expenses and other financial commitments. 
One of Victor's dreams is to improve his life and his family's life. He is an honest and hard-working person.

This is the second time he requests a loan to carry out his projects. He hopes his dreams will become true thanks to the support received.

Trojes, Honduras, August 2014

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a mother of three who runs a small-scale farm in Terige village in North Rift, Kenya. She has been doing this work for four years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

Judith is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to construct a shed for her dairy cows. She is growing concerned about her animal's welfare and safety. The cowshed will provide shade for her cows and protect them from harsh weather. The structure will also improve stock management because she would not have to worry about the cows wandering past their designated grazing bay. 

Any income that she may realize as a result of this investment will go to settling her family's expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Judith replied, " It will increase dairy productivity thus bring income for my family."

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic food products to supply her business with grains, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Beatrece

texts.en:
Beatrece is thirty-seven years old and widowed with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. After losing her husband, Beatrece could not afford to pay school fees for her children and run her farm. 

Beatrece has a dream of educating her children and began a business which can bring in daily income though she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Beatrece wants money to buy goats for fattening and to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats for fattening and  to sell.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado en la escuela, pues por la economía de sus padres no le fue posible terminar sus estudios, está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo que está estudiando en kínder.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, siendo esa la herencia que ellos le dejaron para que pudiera ser independiente, además se dedica al comercio de cerdos, él los compra, los engorda y luego los vende a buen precio.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar dos cerdos con los cuales continuará con su negocio de compra y venta de los mismos.
 
Su sueño es ver crecer a su hijo y seguir trabajando para que a su familia nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
Juan is 27 years old. He studied until the 5th grade in school, but his parents' economic circumstances did not enable him to finish his studies. He is married; his wife takes care of the household chores. He has a son who is in kindergarten. 

Juan has worked in agriculture since childhood, work he learned from his parents. This is the legacy that they left him, to enable him to be independent. He also trades pigs: he buys them, fattens them and then sells them at a good price. 

He needs the loan to buy two pigs with which he will continue his business of buying and selling them. 
 
His dream is to see his son grow up and to continue to work so that his family will never want for anything.

loans.use: to buy two pigs

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 37 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, which sells secondhand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more trousers, t-shirts and bed covers for sale. This will help Aisha to generate greater profits and improve more on her family's standard of living. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more trousers, t-shirts and bed covers for sale

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo is 47 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Damazo has been working hard to manage his mixed farming business. 

To help expand his business, Damazo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize, beans, seeds and manure for his farm, and it will help Damazo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Damazo hopes that in the future he will be able to become a bigger farm supplier of food in Uganda. 

Damazo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Damazo, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans, seeds and manure for his farm

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Anthony, a 30-year-old self-driven man, and a very hardworking and dedicated farmer. He is based in Kiambaa village, a remote area in Thika, which is a semi-arid area. The living conditions in the Thika area are very tough, being a semi-arid area, and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Anthony has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. He is happily married and has been blessed with two children. 

He is a mixed farmer and has been practicing farming for the past 12 years. He has never looked back and does not regret it. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business he engages in to make ends meet. He stated that the most enjoyable part about farming is selling produce in the market. He faces the challenge of lack of feed for his dairy cattle.

He is kindly seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. This helps the animal digest the hay and prevents the cow from rejecting any part of the food. Through this loan the cow will double its milk production. Anthony projects the cow will be producing between 15 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will automatically increase his income and allow him to improve his living conditions. Because of this high milk production potential, he will save more money to fully repay the loan. He believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping his dairy cow, he will have more income, which will improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Bagosphere

texts.en:
BagoSphere is a vocational training company that enables rural youth to gain quick access to gainful employment. BagoSphere provides a unique combination of communication, critical thinking, and life skills training, in just two months, to rural youth. With those skills, rural youth become skilled communicators, and they become highly desired by the call center industry in the Philippines.

With a success rate of 80 percent, BagoSphere’s program enables rural youth to experience a seamless transition from training to working in a multi-national company.

Rural youth form a large base of untapped talent in the Philippines. BagoSphere aims to unlock their talents, to boost the manpower supply for call centers and business process outsourcing (BPO) companies in Bacolod City, thereby fueling the growth of the industry. In turn, the call center jobs provide youth with incomes that are four times higher than unskilled work, enabling them to save toward pursuing their professional and personal development goals.

BagoSphere is the recipient of Singapore International Foundation’s Young Social Entrepreneurs Grant Program and an award winner of Start-up@Singapore’s Social Enterprise competition in 2012. BagoSphere was incubated by Social Venture Lab at the National University of Singapore (NUS). BagoSphere is also supported by Kickstart Ventures (a subsidiary of Globe Telecom), Co.Lab Xchange Incubator, the Small World Group Incubator (SWGI), Impact Investment Exchange (Asia), and the Bago City local government. In addition, it is a member of Innov8 Sparks, the network of technology startup support and funding initiatives founded by members of the SingTel Group.

BagoSphere seeks expansion capital. Being a pioneer in training out-of-school youth for business process outsourcing firms (BPOs) in rural Philippines, BagoSphere has developed a core set of tools, and experience in getting youth into call center jobs. Piloted in Negros Occidental by BagoSphere since 2011, BagoSphere's program has been able to consistently train out-of-school youth in two months to become call center agents, hired by top call centers in Bacolod City. BagoSphere’s partner employers include Teleperformance, Transcom, Teletech, Convergys and Panasiatic Solutions. BagoSphere has trained 103 out-of-school youth to date, and 85% of them found call center jobs within two months of graduation. Dedicated to the social cause of empowering youth with full-time employment, BagoSphere’s engagement with its students lasts beyond the training period. As a result, the long-term (over six months after graduation) employment rate is sustained at over 60%.

BagoSphere’s curriculum was developed with out-of-school youth employment in mind. This involves English communications, IT, financial literacy, and life skills. Already in its seventh iteration, BagoSphere’s curriculum features confidence building and value formation (e.g., professional work ethics, cultivating focus and discipline), integrated into everyday lessons. On the execution end, BagoSphere employs former call center trainers to deliver high-quality training. With a blended revenue model of tuition fees and placement fees, BagoSphere has been able to execute a model that is financially sustainable and helps BPOs save on recruitment costs. Out-of-school youth take a micro-finance loan from NWTF or from BagoSphere, in a "study-now-pay-later” scheme to finance their studies, while BPOs pay BagoSphere a placement fee for every hire.

Having worked with NWTF in 2013, BagoSphere believes that the two organizations' interests are closely aligned. NWTF’s special education loan enables BagoSphere to reduce its operational risk in debt collection, which is not the core strength of BagoSphere. At the same time, NWTF can leverage BagoSphere’s expertise in training youth, to decrease the risk of their educational loans.

The photo features BagoSphere's CEO, Zhihan, as well as other BagoSphere staff and students.

loans.use: to pay for expansion of operations and staff enhancement training, and employ additional working capital

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a forty-year-old man, married with children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His business is cocoa buying and selling besides the cocoa gardens he has. He is a hard-working man and he hopes to have a big store for cocoa.

He wants a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with two kids who are in school. Her main expenses are food and school fees.

Joyce runs a clinic which mainly faces a challenge of seasonality. Her main clients are neighbours and passersby. She is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to purchase more equipment for her clinic.

She decided to join Yehu to access finances to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase extra equipment for the clinic

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta  bachillerato, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja es carpintero, tiene dos hijos y solo la hija menor está estudiando.

Noemi tiene una panadería y una tienda desde hace 5 años, ella emprendió este negocio debido a que quería apoyar a su compañero de vida a obtener más ingresos, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y el horario de atención es de 6:00 AM a 7:00 PM todos los días.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar harina, arroz, maíz, maicillo, frijoles, etc. para continuar trabajando con su panadería y la tienda.

Ella sueña con tener buena salud para seguir trabajando  y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noemi is 49 years old, she studies through high school and she currently has a partner who is a carpenter. She has two children and only her youngest daughter is studying. 

Noemi has owned a bakery and a store for over 5 years. She began these businesses to support her life partner in order to obtain more income. Her business is at her home and her work hours are from 6 AM to 7 PM every day. 

She needs a loan to purchase flour, rice, corn, sorghum, beans, etc. to continue working in her bakery and her store.

She hopes to continue enjoying a good health to continue working and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, corn, sorghum, etc. to continue working with her bakery and the store.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.


María trabaja cuidando niños, además en casa tiene cerdos que los engorda y los vende, su madre fue quien la 
incentivó a realiza estos trabajos para que obtuviera mejores ingresos.


El crédito lo necesita para reparar el techo de su casa ya que no sirve y se acerca el invierno, por eso es urgente repararlo antes.

Su sueño es seguir reparando su casa, y contar siempre con el apoyo de esta institución.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old. She is in a relationship and her partner works as a day laborer. She has two children who are 7 and 10 years old and are studying in school. María works caring for children. She also fattens and sells pigs from her home. She learned this from her mother, who encouraged her to to take on this work to earn a higher income.

She needs this loan to repair the roof of her house, as it is currently not functional. Also, winter is approaching, so it is urgent to repair the roof before then. Her dream is to continue to repair her home, and always have the support of this institution.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house, as it is currently not functional, and winter is approaching.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop. 

Nulu has been in this business for the last 22 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, peas, flour and poultry feed. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

Nulu's goal and aspiration is to build more sheds for poultry farming. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, peas, flour and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young birds (chickens) and their appropriate feed, thus providing employment for a poor father of four

loans.name: José Baltazar

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es padre de 7 hijos de 27, 25, 23, 21, 19, 17, 15. su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, cuidar la casa y unos cuantos animalitos que tienen como gallinas jolotes y cerdos, en la actualidad con él solo viven 5 hijos, ya que los otros dos se acompañaron y ya tienen sus hogares.

José cuenta con una experiencia de 35 años de dedicarse a la siembra de maiz y frijol y algunas veces que a sembrado su poquito de maizillo, esto lo aprendio de su padre ya que él siempre le decia que no habia otra forma de hacer dinero, que se dedicara a cultivar maiz y frijol para tener alimento en la casa.

Con el prestamo comprara 2 sacos de sulfato para su cultivo de maíz. Dice que sus sueños son ver a sus hijos preparados para defenderse en la vida,  a que cada uno sepa como ganarse el sustento diario y a la misma vez darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 50 years old, he studied until the sixth grade, he is the father of 7 children ages: 27, 25, 23, 21, 19, 17 and 15. His wife is in charge of domestic chores, caring for the house and caring for various animals that they own such as chickens and pigs. Currently, only 5 of his children live with him since the other two have partners and have their own homes. 

Jose has been harvesting corn and beans for over 35 years and he has harvested sorghum some times. He learned these skills from his father since it was he who told him that there was no other way of generating income and that he should harvest corn and beans to have foodstuff for his home. 

With the loan he will purchase 2 bags of sulphate to harvest corn. He says that his dream is to see his children ready to confront life, so that each one will know how to make a living and at the same time provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sulphate bags to harvest corn.

loans.name: Yunuke

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Yunuke, a 54-year-old youthful shosho (old mum). She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of three children. She lives with her husband in the rich highlands of the Kisii area of Kenya. 

Yunuke passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past eight years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Yunuke has identified a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture, and milk prices have been going up recently, so Yunuke, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow, but also manure which will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market, and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Yunuke said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. 

Yunuke hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to add value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her three school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alaisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Alaisha operates a grocery in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for two years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sweets, biscuits, rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and flour.  Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy sweets, biscuits, rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Afusa

texts.en:
Afusa is a twenty-five-year-old woman, married with one child, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a beauty salon besides the cocoa garden that supplements her income from the salon. She is a hard-working woman dedicated to her business, though she lacks enough capital to improve her business. She hopes to expand the business.

She wants the loan to buy hair braids to use in her business.

loans.use: to buy hair braids to use in her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is an older man, married with three children who attend school; he is an old client of UGAFODE. He operates a retail shop as his major source of income which he has operated for a period of five years however his major challenge is limited capital. He is taking a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to overcome such a challenge. He decided to join UGAFODE and access financial assistance to boost his business and increase his earnings so as to be able to meet all his financial needs. 

Godfrey thanks UGAFODE for financial assistance which has enabled him to expand his business and educate his children. He also thanks UGAFODE for improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy retail stock for resale

loans.name: Raices Del Manglar Group

texts.es:
TARGELIA  vive en Palma Real (frontera con Colombia) con su hija de 19 años, quien estudia la secundaria. Sus otros 5 hijos ya tienen su propio compromiso y viven en otras ciudades.
TARGELIA ha vivido desde su infancia en este lugar y es muy conocida por todos los habitantes de este sector. Ella realizo su primer crédito con FODEMI hace varios años y desde ese entonces pudo fortalecer su actividad en venta de concha y coco.
Poco a poco ha venido aumentando su negocio y con su esfuerzo apoya a su hija con los gastos de educación – salud y alimentación.
Este negocio lo desarrolla en su casa para aprovechar el espacio. 
Con este nuevo crédito ella se abastecerá de estos productos en especial de coco – que desde hace un tiempo es de mucha venta en esta zona ya que lo están utilizando para la fabricación de jabón de tocador- aceites – galletas – y shampoo.
Ella en 3 años más adelante – espera tener la posibilidad de vender directamente estos productos en las grandes ciudades y así poder obtener mayor beneficio económico.
TARGELIA se siente más tranquila porque gracias a FODEMI y estos créditos- pudo dejar de ir al manglar a conchar (esta actividad es muy peligrosa dice TARGELIA)y ahora pasa más en su casa y trabaja como intermediaria del comercio de la concha y el coco.
Comenta que FODEMI está brindando esta oportunidad a muchas madres que cambian de actividad – dejando la concha por una actividad más segura donde puedan estar al cuidado de sus hijo.
texts.en:
Targelia lives in Parma Real (at the border with Colombia) with her 19 year old daughter, who studies in high school. Her other 5 children have their own businesses and live in other cities. 

Targelia has lived, since infancy, in this place, and she is well known by all the population in this sector. She obtained her first loan from FODEMI several years ago and since then, she was able to strengthen her shell and coconut selling businesses. 

Little by little she has increased her business and with effort she supports her daughter with education expenditures; health and nutrition. 
She manages her business at her house to make use of the space. 

With this new loan she will stock up on supplies, especially coconut; this product has been sold for a long time in the area to fabricate hand soap, oil, cookies and shampoo.

In 3 years she hopes to sell these products in the big cities to obtain greater economic benefits.

Targelia is more calm thanks to FODEMI and the loans since she no longer has to go to the mangrove to search for shells (a very dangerous activity according to Targelia) and now she can spend more time at home. She works as an intermediary for the shell and coconut businesses. 
She mentions that FODEMI is offering this opportunity to many mothers who are switching businesses, abandoning the shell business for a safer business where they can take care of their children.

loans.use: to stock up on coconut - it is sold a lot in this area since it is being used to fabricate hand soap, oils, cookies and shampoo.

loans.name: Yonoki

texts.en:
Yonoki is a thirty-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has spent six years in the business of cocoa buying and selling, and she is working hard to maintain her business.

Yonoki has high hopes of expanding her business to reap more profits. She has requested a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Leon Emilio

texts.es:
El es León, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante y superar el fallecimiento de su esposa.

El se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 15 años en un pequeño carro con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica luego de haber probado suerte con otros trabajos y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar surtido e ingredientes para su negocio, además de cambiar algunos recipientes que tiene en mal estado.

Es un Hombre que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Leon, a man of character and good will. He wishes to progress, move forward and to overcome his wife’s death. 

He decided to begin his food preparation and drinks business 15 years ago in a small car with a lot of eagerness and encouragement. 
He learned these skills empirically after trying his luck with other jobs, thus allowing him to obtain good experience. 

Nowadays he wishes to provide a small push to his business that is why he is requesting a loan to purchase assortments and ingredients for his business, as well as changing some of his containers that are in bad conditions.

He is man who takes challenges and confronts them with bravery.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment and ingredients for his business, as well as changing some of the containers that are in bad conditions.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer born in 1978, who lives in a small village in northern Kenya called Barsombe. In this rural location, he owns a five-acre piece of land that he uses to grow tomato and maize. He also keeps dairy cattle and poultry. He's been selling his produce a few kilometres away at Moiben Market since he started farming in 2002.

James is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce 10 to 15 litres of milk every day, that will be sold at the market. Money from these sales will go to loan repayment and other business expenses. Any profits from this investment will be returned to his business to propel growth.

Your loan will have a great impact on James' life. His hard work thus far has seen him take great care of his four children, his lovely wife Grace, and one employee. With your loan, he hopes to improve his family's livelihood and continue to impact society in a positive manner.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Norman Elias

texts.es:
El Joven Norman ,tiene 27 años de edad vive en compañía de sus padres, y tiene muchos sueños aun por alcanzar, se considera un joven tenaz,comprometido y valiente con la vida, no teme a los retos en cambio le apasiona enfrentarse a los desafíos totalmente aferrado a sus metas, es un joven soñador y para  fija plazos y así luchar por lo que anhela.
Su motivación inicial para continuar con sus estudios es la superación personal y el poder ampliar sus conocimientos en el ámbito académico, el desea poder adquirir beneficios económicos, personales y profesionales mediante la educación propia.

Norman considera que la manera efectiva para poder contribuir al desarrollo de su familia es mediante el estudio, ya que esto servirá de ejemplo a sus hermanos para que ellos puedan desde fijarse metas y motivarse a seguir sus pasos como un excelente estudiante y a la vez profesional, también nos expresa que su familia verán recompensados sus esfuerzos de manera económica.

Norman comenta: Tengo mucha fe en que la situación socio-económica del país puede mejorar y que son los pequeños pero muchos esfuerzos de abajo hacia arriba los que contribuyen a esto.

Como aprendizaje en algún momento de su vida, consideró la posibilidad de trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo pero fuera de su país esto lo hizo sentir un tanto cobarde ya que el debía luchar por lo que realmente quería, así que esas posibilidades de irse a otro país quedo en el pasado esta seguro que su país le dará las oportunidades para que él logre crecer profesionalmente.

Creo en que la plenitud individual se alcanza estando a gusto consigo mismo, siendo fiel a aquello en lo que creemos y buscamos. Los logros económicos son una consecuencia de estar bien consigo mismo, llegan porque las razones por las cuales se vive son honestas y sinceras. En un futuro no muy lejano tengo planes de crear mi propio negocio,en este momento encuentro ganando experiencia, conocimientos y aprendiendo de las personas con exito.
texts.en:
Norman is 27 years old, and lives with his parents. He has many dreams he wants to achieve, and is considered a young, tenacious, brave, and committed. He is not afraid of challenges, but rather is passionate about overcoming them. He is totally driven by his goals; he is a young dreamer who sets deadlines and works hard for what he wants. His initial motivation to continue his education is to improve himself and to expand his knowledge in the academic field, and to be able to acquire economic, personal, and professional benefits through education. 

Norman believes that most effective way to help contribute to his family is through education, as this will set an example for his siblings so that they can set goals and be motivated to follow in his footsteps as an excellent student and professional. He also thinks that education will eventually pay off for his family economically. 

Norman says: “I have great faith that the country’s socio-economic situation can improve through many small, combined efforts.”

At one point in his life he considered the opportunity to both work and study in a foreign country, but this made him feel a little cowardly, since he has to fight for what he really wanted. So those opportunities to go to another country are in the past, but he is confident that his country will give him opportunities to achieve professional growth.

“I believe that individual fulfillment is reached when a person is comfortable with themselves, being true to what they believe and seek. Economic rewards are a result of being true to yourself: they come when people live honestly and sincerely.  In the near future I have plans to create my own business. In the meantime, I am gaining experience, knowledge, and learning from successful people.”

loans.use: to pay for his Master's Degree

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos ya no pudo continuar, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, tiene 4 hijos y dos dependen de ella.

Candelaria tiene 10 años realizando venta de tortillas, lo aprendió gracias a su madre desde que estaba pequeña, el trabajo lo realiza en su casa de 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. 


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para la elaboración de tortillas.

Sus metas son tener un negocio de pupusas y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 43 years old and only studied up to 5th grade of basic education. Due to the scarcity of resources, she could not continue. Candelaria is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She has four children, two of whom are still dependent upon her. 

Candelaria has sold tortillas for ten years, having learned the trade from her mother at a very young age. She does the work at her house from 8:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon.

Candelaria needs the loan to purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas.

Her goals are to open a new business that will make 'pupusas' [El Salvador's most popular snack] and to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood for making tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a single mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bendera has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Bendera dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Victoriano de 33 años de edad  casado y cuenta con 4 hijos el 1 primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene familia separada y los tres hijos últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que victoriano realiza es la siembra de papas y maíz. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en las hortalizas que lo heredo de su padre, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 15 años. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad.

El uso que Victoriano le dará al crédito es para la compra de semillas de papa y abonos químicos e orgánicos para que su producción se de papas se buena este año.  Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture is a profession for people who love the earth like a mother; as a provider of life’s future; the future of hope for the upcoming generations.
 
Agriculture is Victoriano’s job, he is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. His first child already has a family and the other three children study at the community’s school. 

The activity that Victoriano performs is the harvesting of potatoes and corn. He performs this activity in the community in which he resides; he sells his products at the local market in Solola. He performs this job because he is knowledgeable about vegetables; he inherited this from his father. He has performed this activity for over 15 years. He is also a day laborer in his community.

Victoriano will use the loan to purchase potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer to produce a good harvest this year. One of his greatest dreams is to build some rooms for his children so that they can have adequate living conditions and so that one day they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Unity Star Group

texts.en:
This is a group of primary school teachers in their late 40's in a school in Nairobi within Umoja estate. They all use kerosene for lighting. With kerosene lamps, they do not have sufficient light for their children to study and also there is a lot of indoor air pollution from the kerosene fumes which leads to respiratory diseases. 

Currently on average each member spends USD 1.02 on kerosene every day for lighting. The loan will enable them purchase solar lamps SUN KING PRO 2 that will cut their costs of kerosene. The solar is user friendly to both adults and children and they will now be able to channel their finances they used on kerosene to other activities. They will also significantly reduce the chances of house fire brought by kerosene lamps.

loans.use: to pay for a solar lamp

loans.name: Union Maya Group

texts.en:
A visionary group of eight women formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Union Maya,” meaning “Mayan Union,” eight years ago in rural Chichicastenango, Guatemala. Their ultimate goal is to create a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. The average age of the ladies is 41 years, and they each average six children. The women have various small businesses including animal husbandry, production and sale of textiles, fruit and vegetable sales and a bakery.

Josefa, a 60-year-old member of the Trust Bank, is the mother of 11 children. Her family works with her in her bakery business. All are very happy to be able to access working capital through Friendship Bridge. Because of the increased demand  for the bakery's products, Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase butter, sugar, flour, firewood and other necessary supplies. Josefa sells her delicious baked goods in at least three nearby markets as she doesn’t have her own locale. 

The women of the Trust Bank understand the importance of education, not only for themselves but for their children as well. Most of the women have had little or no education at all. Josefa could not afford to send all of her children to school, but is pleased that at least the three youngest children are enrolled in school this year. 

Josefa and her fellow Trust Bank members benefit from the educational training given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer at their monthly meetings. The loans and educational segments of the meetings are what Friendship Bridge has labeled “Microcredit Plus,” and it is a combination that yields great benefits. Some of the topics discussed include women’s health, hygiene and identity, empowerment, self-esteem and leadership as well as effective business management tools. The women are able to develop new personal and financial skills.

The “Union Maya” Trust Bank wants to acknowledge the support of KIVA investors from throughout the world. These loans are a really big step for the ladies, and with the working capital they will be able to maintain or increase their small businesses. In this way, they will generate more income; their families will realize benefits and they will be closer to their goal of eliminating poverty in their lives! Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase butter, sugar, flour, firewood and other necessary supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es: Presentación de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad. Él es un hombre admirable que desde muy joven ha sabido ganarse la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana y es gracias  a este trabajo que sostiene la economía familiar. Presentación desea reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda y además encementar el piso de la misma, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Presentación is 52 years old and lives in his own home together with his two sons who are 20 and 15 years old.

He is a remarkable man who has earned a living from a very young age working in security services in a nearby business, and it is thanks to this work that he sustains the family economically.

Presentación wishes to repair the roof of his modest house and also cement the floor. He is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and wood to carry out this work.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and wood to repair the roof and cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Virgelina
