texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Virgelina es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

Ella tiene un negocio de restaurante donde prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Rionegro, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra surtido e ingredientes para su negocio, además de realizar algunas mejoras locativas.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos siempre disponibles para sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante más grande en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Virgelina's perseverance and courage, her household is now able to have some extra income.

She has a restaurant business in the Rionegro municipality where she prepares and sells fast food.  She undertook this business activity out of the desire to look for new income to support her family.

Her husband and children are the greatest motivation that she has to work every day and to put forth great effort to be better every day.

She hopes to be able to boost her business with the purchase of stock and ingredients for the business.  She will also make some on-site improvements.  With these things she will be able to always have food available for her customers.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a bigger restaurant in the same area so that she does not lose her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock and ingredients and to make some on-site repairs.

loans.name: Rusoroza Tukorere Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Ruth is in the middle of the group photo. She is a member of Rusoroza Tukorere Hamwe Group made up of 5 members. They have taken a loan of 2,500,000 UGX. 

Ruth is a single mother with 2 children and a resident of Rusoroza, Rwerere Parish, Nyakagyeme sub-County, Rukungiri District, in Uganda. Since she wasn't able to acquire enough education, she decided to engage herself in a small-scale business of selling vegetables in order to support her family. 

However, when she found out that the money from her business was not enough to meet all of her family's financial needs, she joined Rusoroza Tukorere Group to borrow funds from UGAFODE. Ruth's 400,000 UGX portion of her group's loan has helped her to buy more vegetables. She expects to earn more after investing this loan properly. 

Ruth is grateful for the support offered by UGAFODE and KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gonzalo Ismael

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un hombre de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 5 años y una hija de 4 años, su negocio es la producción de zapatos.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, buen padre, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Adela’ un lugar caracterizado por el constante crecimiento del comercio en todas las áreas.
Gonzalo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español según el idioma de sus clientes. Su vida la comparte con su pareja y sus tres hijos, su pareja le ayuda en parte de la producción y sus hijos asisten a la escuela, Su casa es propia y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de zapatos, el proceso productivo que realiza; comienza con el diseño del zapato y el patronaje que consiste en plasmar ese diseño que se ha dibujado en papel directamente sobre la horma para después copiarlo en un cartón más duro y sacar las piezas con las que trabajar sobre el material del zapato. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y producir mayor cantidad con mejores materiales. El desea realizar la compra por mayor de material de trabajo, como; cuero, tacos, lona, satén, etc, para abaratar costos y generar mejores beneficios económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Gonzalo solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de confección de zapatos por mayor.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 39 year-old man who lives with his partner.  He has two sons, aged 17 and 5, and a 4 year-old daughter.  He has a business selling shoes.  He is enterprising, independent, a good father, reliable, responsible, and very hardworking.  He does his work in the Villa Adela neighborhood, a place known for its constant growth in commerce in all areas.

Gonzalo has a dark complexion, short black hair, and a medium stature.  His mother tongue is Aymara, and he uses Spanish according to the language of his customers.  He shares his life with his partner and their 3 children.  His partner helps him with his production, and his children attend school.  He has his own house, which has all of the basic utilities.  In his business he makes shoes, and he carries out this productive process himself.  He starts with the design of the shoe, and he makes the pattern by transferring the design that he has drawn on paper directly onto the mold, so that he can later copy it onto more durable cardboard.  Then he puts the pieces that he is working with on the material that he will use to make the shoes. Gonzalo's dream is to expand his business and produce a greater quantity of shoes with better materials.  He wants to purchase raw materials at wholesale such as: leather, heels, canvas, sateen fabric, and other items to lower his costs so that he can generate more profit.

This is why Gonzalo is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make shoes at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes at wholesale

loans.name: Flor Marlene

texts.es: Flor de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y  habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos una niña de 10 años y 2 varones de 15 y 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar por medio de su negocio de venta de una gran variedad de ropa la cual distribuye en los cantones cercanos y sitios con bastante afluencia. Flor desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y lamina para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Flor, age 38, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her three children, a 10 year old girl and two boys, ages 15 and 20.  She is a woman who, thanks to her effort and tenacity, has managed to support her family through her business of selling a great variety of clothes.  She distributes the clothes in the nearby cantons and places with plenty of people passing by.

Flor wishes to build a fourth bedroom in her house.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and metal sheeting to build a fourth bedroom in her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is an artisan from Bali who specializes in masks and wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of suar and crocodile wood, as well as hire additional carvers for his workshop. Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: Nyoman was taught to carve by his brother. "The traditional forms and poses are of strong beauty and fine workmanship, which inspired me to learn this style. My favorite themes to work on are characters in religious mythology, because they offer a variety of ways for an artist to express creativity and style. What I wish now is to continue upholding the values of those who taught and inspired me, while being able to continue taking very good care of my family and my woodcarving group." "I am having a difficult time now because many of the carvers that helped me to produce the statues and carved items prefer to leave their creative job and work in the construction business instead because the income is higher there. Thanks to this loan, I will be able to buy wood and find new carvers who can help me to carve classic Balinese statuettes. This way I will be prepared for the upcoming holiday season. Thanks for your support!" Use the link below to view Nyoman's masks and wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/381

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of suar and crocodile wood, as well as hire additional carvers for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Mujeres Franciscana Group

texts.en:
Panajachel is a lively town on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is quite popular with tourists who have come here for many decades.  Eight women have recently joined together and formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Franciscana”. The ladies have various commercial businesses including catalogue sales (cosmetics and cleaning products), hand-woven textiles as well as the manufacture and sale of crafts and folk art. 

Birma is a 42-year-old member of the group and has four children. Three of the children are in school which makes Birma quite happy as she lacked one year to complete high school. She wants all of her children to complete their college education. Her husband is a painter and the couple works hard to take care of the family. Birma has a craft business and sells ornaments and decorations for quinceañeras, baptisms, graduation ornaments, and weddings. She needs a loan to buy more raw materials including paper, silicone guns, ribbons, threads, among other necessary materials to keep the business moving. Birma is usually quite busy but at this time of year. Her workload increases because school graduations are approaching and there are many celebrations.

The members of the Trust Bank, many of whom were unable to complete their schooling, are happy to participate in the educational part of their monthly meetings. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education, gives the ladies some useful personal and business tools that they can put to use immediately. Subjects covered include violence against women, women’s rights, health, nutrition and hygiene as well as the use of medicinal plants. The women learn how to successfully manage their small loans with information about business planning, budgeting, marketing and customer service.

Birma and her friends in the Trust Bank are grateful for the opportunity to have a loan because they have a real desire to excel. Without a helping hand, this would be most difficult. Kiva investors are very much appreciated by the ladies in the Trust Bank. The appreciate the lenders' generosity in funding loans. They send their most heartfelt wishes and gratitude to Kiva investors. We look forward to reporting on their progress!

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 34 years old and married with three children, who are all in school.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Analiza aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 4-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 120-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Brenda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Brenda is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is single and has a rental house business in the Philippines.

Erlina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies to repair her boarding house.

Erlina has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Erlina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies to repair her boarding house.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is 53 years old and married with six children. Five of her children attend school.

Heide works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF  to purchase groceries to sell.

She earns additional income from food vending.

Heide aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jalyn

texts.en:
Jalyn is a 33-year-old hard working married entrepreneur with four children. She has three children who attend school.

Jalyn has had a dried fish vending business for 2 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish business.

In the future, Jalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and metal sheeting to build a pila (a large wash basin) and a hall in her home.

loans.name: Ma. Haydee

texts.en:
Ma. Haydee is 43 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

Ma. Haydee works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ma. Haydee aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and earns additional income operating a general store. Janet requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is 32 years old and married with three children.

Elida works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 3 years.  She requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  snack food, soft-drinks, juice, coffee, and biscuits to sell.

Elida has previously borrowed  and repaid 1 loan from NWTF. She earns additional income from food vending.

Elida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy snack food, soft-drinks, juice, coffee, and biscuits.

loans.name: Santos Adiel

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 47 años de edad, no estudio, porque en su tiempo de niñez a él no le gustaba ir a la escuela; pero pasado el tiempo cuando ya tenia conocimientos él se lamentaba, porque no valoro la oportunidad que sus padres le dieron para que fuera a la escuela. Hoy ya grande dice que quizo aprender a leer para que nadie lo engañara y aprendio poco a poco a leer y a poner su firma. Es padre de 3 hijos de 30,25,23 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos tambien a la cria de animales como, gallina, pollos, patos y un burrito que tienen. De los hijos dos ya estan acompañados y solo uno vive con ellos.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 37 años y lo aprendio de su padre.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un saco de abono para darle la ultima abonada a su cosecha de maíz y para pagar a los dos mosos que le ayudan en la milpa. Esta con la ilusión que con el préstamo podra comprar lo que necesita y a esperar que Dios le permita cosechar lo suficiente para pagar el crédito y poder dejar para el cosumo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 47-year-old man. He didn't go to school because, during his childhood, he didn't like to go to school. But later when he had more understanding, he regretted it because he didn't value the opportunity that his parents gave him to go to school.  Now, as an adult, he says that he wanted to learn to read so that no one would deceive him, and he learned little by little to read and to sign his own name. He is the father of three children, ages 30, 25, and 23.  His wife takes care of the household tasks and also raises animals such as chickens, hens, ducks and a burro that they have. Of the children, two are partnered and only one lives with them. 

Santos has worked in agriculture for the past 37 years and learned how from his father.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase a bag of fertilizer to apply the last fertilization to the corn crop and to pay the two workers who help him in the corn field.  He has the idea that with the loan he will be able to purchase the necessary supplies and hope that God permits him to harvest enough to pay off the loan and to to be able to leave some for consumption.

loans.use: to buy a bag of fertilizer to apply the last fertilization to the corn crop and to pay the two workers who help him in the corn field.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas has been involved in business since 2011. She started her business with her capital investment of $ 400.00. She has a kiosk in her house but her capital is not enough to buy more goods. She requests  $ 800.00 USD from Tuba Rai Metin  to buy  additional supplies to keep in her kiosk.  She would like to purchase shampoo, noodles, milk, biscuits, coffee, lighters, eggs, cigarettes, candies, soft drinks, and other items. 

She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, noodles, milk, biscuits, coffee, lighters, eggs, cigarettes, candies, soft drinks, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a married woman with three children, she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income raising pigs. Jona requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase snack food, sardines, diapers, and other groceries for her general store.

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain he dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  snack food, sardines, diapers, and other groceries.

loans.name: Doratea

texts.en:
Doratea is applying for a loan of 800 USD. She has a kiosk and she is a businesswoman. The stock in her stall is very low, so she wants to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add more items to her stall. She will use this loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including candies, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, lighters, pens and other things to sell. 

Doratea started her business in 2005 with working capital of 200 USD. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy candies, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, lighters, pens and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lazaro De Jesus

texts.es: Lázaro de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que todos los días pone todo de su esfuerzo para salir adelante al lado de su familia y es por ello que se gana la vida comprando y vendiendo ganado desde hace mucho tiempo. Lázaro buscando la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos ha decidido mejorar las paredes, el techo y el piso de su vivienda ya que el piso es de tierra y desea encementarlo, las paredes son de bajareque y quiere repellarlas y el techo se encuentra deteriorado y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, lámina, hierro y clavos para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Lázaro, 28 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their 2 children, ages 13 and 6.  He is a hard-working man who, every day, puts all his efforts into getting ahead alongside his family and for this reason he has earned a living buying and selling cattle for a long time. Lázaro, looking for a way to improve his loved ones' quality of life, has decided to improve the walls, roof and floor of his house since the floor is dirt and he wants to cement it, the walls are made of mud and he wants to plaster them, and the roof is deteriorating and for this reason he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, metal sheeting, iron, and nails to make some improvements on his house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, metal sheeting, iron, and nails to make some improvements on his house.

loans.name: Luzil

texts.en:
Luzil is 34 years old and married with four children, three attend school.

Luzil works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She  earns additional income from food vending.

Luzil aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a 42-year-old married entrepreneur with six children.  Four children attend school.

Esperanza has operated a general store business for 5 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

 In the future, Esperanza would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 47-year-old married woman with four children, two children attend school.

Lucia has raised pigs for 2 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 46-year-old married woman with four children. Two children atten school.

Felipa has grown vegetables and rootcrops for 3 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 5 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 47 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Leonita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonita has been farming rice for four years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Leonita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 28 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Manilyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Manilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º año de bachillerato, su pareja es empleada de la alcaldía, tiene 3 hijos, solo uno asiste a la escuela y los otros dos que son gemelos aún no van. 

David trabaja de empleado en una gasolinera del centro de la ciudad, desde hace tres años se decidió a buscar trabajo porque tiene familia a quien mantener.


Él necesita el préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora y una cocina pues le hacen mucha falta en su hogar.

Sus sueños son que su familia tenga todos lo que necesitan, siempre tener empleo para obtener ingresos y pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and studied through the third year of secondary school.  His wife is a local government employee, they have 3 children, and only one goes to school and the other two are twins who don't go yet.

David works as an employee at a gas station in the city center. For the past three years, he has looked for work because he has a family to maintain.  

He needs the loan to purchase a refrigerator and a range because they are very needed in his home.

His dreams are that his family has all that it needs, always to have a job to have an income, and to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and a range since they are very needed in his home.

loans.name: Serason Indah Group

texts.en:
This is the fifth loan for Serason Indah Group and they have paid all their loans on time. The group's seven members can keep pigs well and the pigs grow rapidly. No diseases have attacked the pigs because the members always give the pigs vitamins and nutrious feed.

Ni Made, as the head, has succeeded in organizing the group and in selling her pigs. She earns 250,000 IDR per pig. She has four pigs. Ni Made also earns a profit from her small kiosk business. She’s really satisfied with the results. She says thank you to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business. She keeps her profit as savings for future needs.

After evaluating the last loan, the Serason Indah Group decided to propose a new loan. With the same loan amount, each member will receive 3,500,000 IDR. Ni Made will use her loan to purchase merchandise for her kiosk and superior feed for her pigs. 

Now Ni Made still has pigs in her cage. She lives with her husband, who works as a farmer, and two children. Ni Made and her husband work and save their money to support their children's education. They hope and dream for a bright future for their children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her kiosk and superior feed for her pigs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has sold ready-to-wear clothing for 2 years.

Julieta requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear items to sell.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase  ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Merdeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Merdeta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending.  Merdeta is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Merdeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel, a 37-year-old married mother of six, has been farming rice in the Philippines for four years, and earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maribel is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 30 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock, such as vinegar, candies, snack foods, candles, biscuits and canned goods, to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, candies, snack foods, candles, biscuits, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as vinegar, candies, snack foods, candles, biscuits and canned goods

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda, a 35-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store for six years in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs and selling purified drinking water.

Mylinda, who has borrowed and repaid one previous loan from NWTF,  has requested a new one for PHP 8000 to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bed sheets and mosquito nets in bulk.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга — из Павлограда. Она имеет одну торговую точку на местном рынке, торгует мужской одеждой. Торговое место у нее собственное. Опыт работы — больше 20 лет. 
Ольга намерена на 10 000 гривен закупить товар осеннего ассортимента, а именно: свитера, толстовки, рубашки, брюки, футболки. Несмотря на спады торговли, Ольга надеется, что ситуация изменится и ее товар найдет своего покупателя. Прибыль, которую Ольга получит от реализации этой партии товара, она вложит в бизнес, как поступает обычно. Она старается делать все возможное, чтобы бизнес был успешным: обновляет ассортимент, закупает интересные модели в разной цветовой гамме.
texts.en:
Olga is from Pavlograd. She has a shop at the local market where she sells men's clothing. It is her own shop and she has more than 20 years of work experience.

Olga wants to use 10,000 griven to purchase an assortment of fall merchandise, specifically sweaters, sweatshirts, shirts, pants and T-shirts. Despite the slowdown of trade, Olga hopes that the situation will change and her goods will find their buyers. She will invest profits that she receives from these goods back into her business, as per usual. She tried to do everything possible to make her business successful, such as by renewing merchandise and purchasing interesting designs in a variety of colours.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fall merchandise

loans.name: Horacio Edilberto

texts.es: Horacio de 58 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la crianza de cerdos y a la venta de cocos, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias logra solventar los gastos del hogar, Horacio  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Horacio is 58 years old and lives with his wife and their two children. He has been raising pigs and selling coconuts for 10 years. Horacio sells his products at different markets that are located near his home. With his earnings, he is able to take care of the household expenses.

Horacio is requesting a loan so that he can buy more pigs. This is his only source of income, so the loan will allow him to continue working so that he can generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Elvie

texts.en:
Ma. Elvie, a 33-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Ma. Elvie has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and married, with two children, one of whom is in school. Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as charcoal, rice, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nora works hard to support her family. She has a photocopying business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. 

Nora, who received a previous loan, is requesting a new one for PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials such as bond paper, ink, etc. for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bond paper, ink, etc. for her business

loans.name: Efrain Atilio

texts.es:
Efrain tiene 52 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de 5 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, sus hijos le apoyan con las siembras despues del estudio, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Él siempre a sido un hombre muy dedicado a su familia para que nunca les falte el sustento.

El crédito lo necesita para hacer una reparación a su vehiculo en cambiarle unas llantas y hacerle uns cambios y a su casa, necesita repararle el techo porque tiene huecos y en esta epoca de invierno es una problematica en su hogar.

El sueño de Efrain es que sus hijos estudien hasta obtener un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Efrain is 52 years old, married, and the father of five children. He has been a farmer for several years. His children help him with planting crops after they’re done with school. His wife takes care of the household chores. Efrain has always been a man who is devoted to his family so that they would never be lacking in basic needs.

He needs a loan so that he can make repairs to his vehicle, such as replacing the tires. Repairs also need to be done on his house. He needs to fix the roof because there are holes that cause problems for his family during the winter season.

Efrain dreams of seeing his children study until they obtain their university degrees.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house and to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. 

She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add to her working capital. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as candies, noodles, pens, lighters, biscuits, salt, soap, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, slippers and other things to sell. 

Angelina  opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $280. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She hopes with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can manage her business well in the future.

loans.use: to buy candies, noodles, pens, lighters, biscuits, salt, soap, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, slippers etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Originally from Brazil, Nelson had prior experience with clothing graphic design before opening his own company five years ago. His business supports his wife and two children, as well as his mother in Brazil. 

Nelson has been able to obtain some contract work with large clients and is looking for a loan to help develop a marketing strategy to keep up his momentum.

Nelson says, “I want to be a premier business in the printing industry in my region. Personally, I would like to pursue a graphic design degree.”

loans.use: to develop a marketing strategy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for studio improvements and to purchase office equipment.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia has worked in tax preparation for over three years, and her clients encouraged her to open her own business – so she did! “I wanted to grow as an individual, and I wanted to obtain financial freedom,” Sophia says. Working now in the greater Miami area, Sophia is proud to provide for her son. 

As a newer small business owner, she has learned by doing: “The first time around is always a learning experience.” For example, she now has a system to organize and budget for her business, a result of some of those learning experiences.

Sophia needs a loan to upgrade her software and purchase office supplies, including furniture. “Eventually,” Sophia says, “I see my business transitioning into a commercial setting, where I would have an actual office location.” And, she hopes to hire employees to help with the business. As the business grows, Sophia has her sights set on home ownership.

loans.use: to pay for updated software and office furniture.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza has been involved in agricultural activities since 2011 with her own working capital of $20. She plants vegetables, and after the vegetables have grown, she brings them to market to sell. 

Now Eliza is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. Her everyday life involves planting vegetables because she is able to earn a good income from this. 

She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more manure, vegetable seeds, and other materials. She is happy that she is able to borrow money from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy manure, vegetable seeds, and other materials.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Rufina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rufina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Roselyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business. Roselyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en: Sherlie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc.  Sherlie has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: As a married mother of eight children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening businesses. Susan is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old, married, and has five children all of whom are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan is 42 years old and married with four children.  She is living in a village in the Takeo province of Cambodia. One of her children is a construction worker, one is a cloth carpet weaver and two are students. 

Sokhan and her 44-year-old husband buy mangoes and wood apples (a kind of tropical fruit) to sell. She would like to request a loan to buy more mangoes and wood apples to sell at the market in the city. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more fruit to sell and earn more income. 

In the future, she wants to have a small Korean truck for transporting fruit to sell, renovate her house and support her children in finishing high school.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes and wood apples to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 44 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are currently in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 52 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a manicure/pedicure service. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old and married. She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  Teresa is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,800 purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her manufacturing business. With your help, Teresa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Julieta has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 17 years now. Julieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eustracia

texts.en:
Eustracia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vinegar in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more containers of vinegar to sell to her customers.

Eustracia has been in this business for 20 years. Eustracia earns more income from selling charcoal.

Eustracia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of vinegar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 65 years old, married and has seven children.

Corazon and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Corazon is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9714 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Corazon has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Corazon can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 65 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Teresita is taking out a PHP 7,850 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Teresita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sherlina

texts.en:
Sherlina is 52 years old and has ten children. She is married and has three children who are still in school. Sherlina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sherlina has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 46 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Myrna has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for five years. Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 65 years old and married with four children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Violeta aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is 52 years old and married with five children. Anaclita works very hard to provide for them.

Anaclita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, etc., to sell.

Anaclita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, etc. 

Anaclita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and has three children. Maricel is married, and all three children are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maricel requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Maricel has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
A USD 800 amount is offered to Filomena to improve her business. She is a businesswoman.  She sells rice because many people come to buy everyday. She will use this loan to buy additional supplies such as rice. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013 with her own working capital of USD 250. 

She feels so comfortable running her business, because she can earn money everyday. Running a business has made Filomena independent, because she can be responsible for her family.  With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is Jenni Mari's mother. Jenni Mari is 17 years old and is studying to receive a Bachelors of Science degree in Elementary Education. She is currently in the first year of a four-year program.

Grace is seeking a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to pay for Jenni Mari's tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year. With the loan proceeds, Jenni Mari expects to be able to graduate and to then be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Ha Duong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ha Thi Duong was born in 1967 and is from Thailand. She lives with her husband and their two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district in Son La province. She joined the M7-MFI program in 1996 and is one of the earliest members of her cluster.

Her family’s main occupation is farming and livestock breeding, but they are unable to generate much income. After learning from experiences of successful households in the area, she decided to change their practice of using chemical fertilizers to instead use organic fertilizers for her coffee trees. She believes that the switch will enable them to improve their soil, with the added benefit of improving environment.

Therefore, she is seeking to borrow a loan to pay for the first step of this transformation. She expects that the new method of caring for her trees will help her family have a bumper harvest and thereby increase their income.

loans.use: to improve her family's farming operations by switching from the use of chemical fertilizers to organic fertilizers

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through four prior loans from NWTF. She explains that she earns additional income by making barbecue sticks.

Jonalyn is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients and other items for her food production business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to expand and improve her food production business by purchasing additional ingredients and other items

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 57 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Divina's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Divina is taking out a 9714.20 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Divina has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tanya Geraldina

texts.es:
Tanya es una joven de 22 años de edad, está estudiando en la universidad Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, y solo tiene un hijo que ya asiste a la escuela.

Tanya se dedica a vender productos de revistas como perfumes, cosméticos entre otros, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde que comenzó a estudiar, de esta forma puede costearse los estudios y ayudar en los gastos del hogar.

Ella necesita el crédito para pagar sus gastos universitarios y comprar algunos útiles de estudio.

Su sueño es terminar la universidad y conseguir un buen trabajo para darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: Tanya is a young 22 year old woman. She is studying a bachelors in Business Administration at the university. She has a domestic partner who works as a mason. She has a son who is already in school. Tanya works selling products by catalog such as perfumes and cosmetic items. She has worked in this business since she started studying. With this job she has been able to pay for her studies and help with household expenses. She needs a loan to pay for her college expenses and to buy some school supplies. Her dream is to finish college and get a good job, so she can give her son all the best.

loans.use: to pay for college expenses and to buy some school supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de ganado de engorde y a la siembra de granos básicos, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganado de engorde ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: 36-year-old Jose lives with his wife and three children. He has made a living for the past five years by breeding livestock for meat and planting staple grains. He sells his products in the different markets that are near his house. Jose is requesting a loan in order to buy more beef cattle since this is his only source of work, and in this way he will be able to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy more beef cattle

loans.name: Erlis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Erlis de 30 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 4 años, esta acompañada, se dedica a los oficios domesticos y trabaja con ganado bovino, lo a hecho por mas de 4 años y lo aprendio de sus padres, deicidio hacerlo buscando un ingreso economico.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto. Co ello tendra oportunidad de seguir trabajando y generando ganancias, por lo tanto tendra mejor calidad de vida, la necesidad satisfecha es que puede comprar para seguir trabajando sin limitantes.
texts.en:
Erlis is 30 years old, in a relationship and has a 4 year old son. She works doing domestic work and raises cattle. She has done this for 4 years. She learned the business from her parents and decided to do it looking for economic income.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy cattle. Doing this she has the opportunity to continue working and generating income and she will have a higher quality of living. The need filled is that she can buy in order to keep working without restriction.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Pabla Maria

texts.es:
Creatividad y estética son las dos fortalezas de la señora Pabla que con ganas y sacrificio monto una peluquería en el sector de Cáceres y que con trabajo, ahorros y con un pequeño crédito que solicita un la corporación interactuar quiere ampliar y mejorar sus servicios teniendo aparte de la peluquería una mini-tienda donde las personas puedan encontrar todo lo relacionado con la belleza.
Con el crédito solicitado ajustara para comprar dos vitrinas e insumos como cosméticos, artículos para el cabello. 
Gracias a este crédito su tienda tomara forma consolidándose como una de las más completas del sector donde los principales beneficiados serán los clientes,
texts.en:
Creativity and esthetics are two strengths of Pabla who with desire and sacrifice opened a hair salon in the area of Cáceres. With her work and savings and a small loan from Interactuar she wants to expand and improve her services. She will have a small mini store besides her hair salon where people can find anything related to beauty.

She will use the loan to buy two display cases and supplies like cosmetics and articles for the hair. Thanks to this loan her store will take form, becoming one of the most complete in the area where the main beneficiaries will be the customers.

loans.use: to buy two display cases and a stock of cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Julia Hilda

texts.es: Julia tiene 57 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas mayores de edad. Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la prestación servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Julia es muy responsable y trabajadora Y hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Julia desea reparar una pared en su vivienda dado que se encuentra dañada. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento y hierro y poder así reparar la pared de su vivienda.
texts.en: Julia is 57 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and their two adult daughters. Julia is a very hard-working woman whose work for a long time has been providing domestic services. Julia is very responsible and hard-working and makes every effort to give her family better living conditions. Julia wants to repair a wall in her house, given that it is damaged. To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, and iron and thus be able to repair the wall of her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and iron and be able to repair the wall of her house.
